SoWFcH4-DECfYG7ZMWZefA.text: This is seriously one of the best restaurants in Scottsdale. The food was terrific, the service was excellent and its a great place for a date on any budget!

o9t-YSx-T59Q823euRy6Sw.text: A little disappointing in light of all the rave reviews we read before going there. The eggplant curry was very salty and the spice level definitely tasted more like a level two instead of the level one that the menu indicated.  The pad tai was a little too sweet for us. The pad seew (flat wide noodle) was very greasy and had some noodle pieces that were charred and tasted burnt. The food took a long time to come even though there was no one else there when we sat down. I understand that the ingredients are fresh and from scratch so maybe that's why it took longer.  As other reviews have mentioned, the price was high for the small portions, especially the hefty upcharge for the forbidden rice. The owner/chef was very friendly when we sat down, but the wait staff was not attentive, probably because there were only two people (one of whom was the bartender) working the whole room which filled up quickly. We are glad we tried something new but probably will not come back.

8EPI4MnR3Q2tESHunMbUVw.text: I recently moved to the area and was looking for a great Thai restaurant. I am a huge fan of thai food and this place was spectacular!! I will definetely be going back. The service was amazing a long with the atmosphere. I took my boyfriend who is not the biggest fan of thai food but he loved this place! They have a little bit of everything for everyone. I highly recommend ordering the tom kah gah. I love that they serve forbidden rice. Great stuff!!!!

zIJ0vidOVVEMhDqD7fNX9Q.text: Pumpkin Curry & Pad Thai, Oh My!!!  Doesn't get any better anywhere!

2a4ACcMX1gxzZ4Tg21aiIQ.text: Food was excellent...service requires new processes and redesign..food was a 5 so you can make your own conclusion about the service.

zkyGp87V9V0fJH-FssrhVA.text: This was our first visit and I will go back again!  I ordered Red Curry Chicken and it was very tasty.  My husband ordered Thai Basil Chicken and he was also happy with his dish.  Our waiter was prompt with service, polite and very helpful with suggestions.  I ordered my dish on the mild side and it was plenty spicy for me.  I look forward to eating here again.  If you never had Thai food and wanted to try it, I would suggest this place for a few reasons.  First, it was very clean.  Second, staff will answer all your questions and help you with your selection. Third, food is served in a timely manner, hot and fresh.

dM1t5Z7k08ZfVVP0OEQmdw.text: Excellent dishes, great owners, as good a Thai restaurant anywhere in the country. Look forward to our next trip here.    Arnold & Lana Topeka, Kansas

NkVSyY18q2LxO4x1nwSBJg.text: This place is not only the worst thai place ever but the most expensive plate that I have ever paid for. Fist of all the chief was not a person from Thailand   The place was far from ethnic thai.  The plate was $15 for a very small proportion of food

GvCnO2Uxj4eWuNmYwTtyAw.text: This is by far the worst Thai place I've ever been too. I regularly try new Thai places and have been to many of them in Arizona. The price for the portion of food is astonishing. The pad Thai did not taste good either. I recommend to stay away from this place and check out other more authentic Thai places in the area.

bmBnWI7llwFhxwJSFWsYpg.text: Food was great service was great I highly recommend Takeda Thai.  The edammae was amazing, so was the coconut ice cream!

UNLYXAZ315-IglTEMcRPEQ.text: I've been doing well by visiting Yelp reviewed places so that is how I found Takeda Thai.  A little difficult to find as it is set back quite a ways from the SE corner of Shea & Scottsdale.  I entered for lunch and two white guys were working the tables.  Nice interior, food was tasty and fast, but seriously small portions.  Then again the lunch special only costs $7.95 which gets you a main and a soup.  I had the spicey noodles (Phad kee mow) with chicken at 3 stars (out of 4 possible).  It was tasty and I enjoyed it, seemed slightly reserved on heat but they probably didn't want to offend anyone and I still enjoyed it very much.  Where the rip is on the drinks as they charged $2.95 for a soft drink.  Add 20% for tip and it pushed it to over $14.   That's just not good value and it hit me wrong.

HKbzitalpLOknh-1dQJBXw.text: They use fresh ingredients every day, and you can taste the difference between this and other Thai restaurants. The quality is great and although it is a couple bucks more than what you would normally spend, it is worth it.  The atmosphere and interior is much nicer than you would expect at a Thai restaurant as well. If you dine-in, their presentation is surprisingly well done.  I really like their Panang Curry here, best I've tried... ever.  Their Pad Thai is nothing special, though... I think ours had like 2 total pieces of shrimp.  Pretty solid overall.

ZHD8-gIOX0BzPxsnSG5CTw.text: Thinking to spend the evening in a restaurant for a long talk to catch up with your old friends, this will be your place.    The restaurant is located at the intersection of scottsdale & shea .... when you drove by, it is very easy to spot as this is probably the only restaurant / shop open in the plaza.  Inside out, the ambience of the restaurant is great if you can overlook the shopping center is kind of run-down.  It doesn't look like your typical thai restaurant. It has low light and very chic deco, quite a cute place I must say in term of ambience.   In term of food, the quality is a OK ... nothing to wow about. Ordered basil beef and the uncle som's seafood ... both are good traditional thai food. It's good but nothing out of the ordinary, both the cut of meat and seafood are not great ... I can get the same quality of dishes at another Thai restaurant right around the corner for 50% off their price. This is not a place for the value of food, rather, the price you pay is more for the ambience.  And I must agree with my fellow yelpers that the service is SLOW ... yes, I do undersand that everything is made to order ... but honestly, so do any other thai restaurant. Thai food is not something you can pre-cook anyway.   And in term of slow, it's not only in the kitchen, also the front end service. Our server was slow , not in term of time to place order and checking ...  but he was slow to understand ... or he was plain ignoring what was requested.  I asked for the pepper tray THREE times .... still no pepper tray when I paid the bill. And he got the bill wrong and I kindly pointed that out to him, and he brought back the exact same bill :-\ ... not the kind of service I would expect in this type of restaurant.   Overall, good place to spend the evening to have long conversation and have decent food with good atmosphere if you are willing to pay for the ambience

E1-f0bxG8PvEW7Qsk7_3tw.text: Takeda Thai is very good at interior decorating, but not actually preparing well made Thai food. If you really know authentic Thai food you will not be happy here. Those that don't know better may be OK with the food here.   The Thai Beef Salad was very disappointing.  Very salty, overly seasoned, and not tasty.  The beef itself was hard and chewy. This can be such a wonderful dish when prepared correctly.   The Tom Yum chicken soup I ordered 2/4 stars on the spice level, was incredibly spicy- focusing on hot spice rather than balanced flavor.    We walked out with a $35 bill and still very hungry, as we barely ate 1/4 of our feed before just giving up and leaving.  Truly an expensive and greatly disappointing dining experience.

eIWxSXLPMRLZBvt_5o4xFA.text: Amazing food with ok service.  Charred edamame was unique and very tasty.  Careful when ordering anything "hot," they mean HOT!  Will definitely return!

F-iSt9ae3cQIsq8Umm2PLw.text: I love this place! Food is consistent and delicious. Decor is simple, modern, clean. The owners are frequently on the premises and are very gracious. I have tried almost every item on the menu and have enjoyed everything.

7J5dnp0mIqWF6d41jHrg9Q.text: Having visited this place several times in the past year, I have been meaning to Yelp and finally got around to it.  Takeda Thai's Tom Kha Gai soup is the best I have had.  I enjoyed it so much the first time that I came in the next night and ordered another bowl.  It is the first thing I order, sometimes even before I decide on my drink. I love that it is locally and independently owned.  I also think Pete (our usual server/bartender) does an awesome job.    The Pad Thai is not my most favorite-maybe because I like mine with tons of sauce,green onions, lime, and cilantro and Takeda Thai's is more restrained.  I think the Green Curry is fresh, light, and perfectly seasoned.  I also love the Pad See Yew.  I wish they would offer Moroccan Tea ALL the time- if Moulay had this available daily, I would be there daily.  It was a life changing tea experience.  I have to settle for the Thai Iced Tea, which is good, but not nearly as delicious.  Overall, I love supporting my neighborhood and avoiding the chain restaurants and am always satisfied here.

WFeSDRYsJKCEsKH39fk2iQ.text: The food was OK, not great.  Lettuce wraps difficult to eat with tiny pieces of romaine.  The waitress talked me out of my fried rice dish to one she recommended and was not like any fried rice I've ever had and not  something I would order again.  Terrible wine list, one red, one white. The service was excellent , but the food and portions probably won't prompt a quick return.  This was much better the last time we were there.  The owner/chef was very charming and I hope they are successful. ,

ppjaJ-g3lZ2BdiCdpJDj7Q.text: Overpriced. The pad Thai noodles were mushy, brown rice was very bland and dry. The 3 season chicken was deep fried and seemed to be thrown in with pineapples and green peppers were sparse. Portions small for amount charged. Best dish was the glass noodle salad, which did not have enough lettuce. Server asked how food was, we told him not good and he thought we were joking. Gave him input, but they did not seem to care. Save your money and go elsewhere.

7084saIynCFAKJXNPo8cdg.text: Best Thai place ever! Everything is fantastic-my favorite is the korobe ultimate fried rice!

U-2LbGqGGwIyQ06r06xSrQ.text: This is not a place to go if you're in a hurry. It's freshly made delicious food. Enjoy!

5M8NF9B9ZubliKqPyCz9mQ.text: Ah yes, it was time to go home and that ever pending question "what's for dinner?" nagged at me.  I had just passed one Thai restaurant on Shea Blvd and thought of turning around to go back, but then I spotted Takeda Thai through the parking lot.  It was amongst some businesses which were not restaurants so at quick glance, I thought it might be a massage parlour or spa.   Anyway, my stomach must have subconsciously known the deal, because I continued straight in that direction and upon entering rejoiced - it was in fact a  restaurant.  Two seconds later I was kindly greeted by a gentleman who led me to the bar to order take-out.  He let me know that everything is made-to-order and any dish I wanted could be prepared vegetarian.  Super cool!   He also let me know the spice scale.  All the curries sounded delicious and I finally opted for the eggplant curry.  Good choice.  My weakness for spring rolls got the better of me at the sight of the word "crispy" on the menu and I asked for those veggie as well.  Excellent choice.  They. Were.  C R I S P Y.  And fried in an oil that wasn't heavy.  So were they gobbled up before I got home?  Naturally.  The eggplant was very delicious too.  It's mild flavor had a hint of spiciness which was perfect.  Mild should not mean "flat."  Garlic and basil were prevalent as well.  If I could change anything, I would ask for a larger serving.

hYaK3-NMqOO-gQm_17L-7Q.text: What a great find.  The food here is excellent.  We came from the Bay Area where Thai food was always good.  This was a big surprise.  The pumpkin curry, pad Thai and chicken curry dishes were finished completely.  The people are nice and they make great specialty cocktails.

pWHwfvH1l4eMxfqXmDP99A.text: Last night we enjoyed the wonderful food at Takeda Thai.  This was our second visit and it was as good as the first. The chef is very nice and takes time to greet each customer and chat with them.  We tried the charred edamame and it was delicious as was the lettuce wraps.  I ordered the pad thai and it was perfect.  The medium spice level was just right for me.  My husband ordered the green curry with steak.  He also enjoyed the heat of the medium spice and gobbled it all up.  His mojito was a perfect compiment to his dish and had lots of fresh mint leaves.  I love the friendly atmosphere and the beautiful decor of this place. We will definitely be back soon and hope to share this restaurant with friends.

4IdSEnYJqgq2CZ-N2MFXxQ.text: Take-out: the yellow curry with pork and flat noodles with beef were delicious but the portions were small and a bit pricey.

qXLMyVhSNV_NBiQ96NXxbQ.text: Came here after a LONG day at work and conveniently it's next door to my office! I popped in and had a glass of wine and Pad Thai with Crab Pockets and let me tell you... Bu far the best pad thai and crab puff I have ever had. Im an avid thai lover and I am very picky about my dishes but it was so good! The dim lighting, soft music and friendly staff made my first experience a very pleasant one. Can't wait to come back with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vpMeffV7tWHJF1lSRVl1EA.text: Just happened upon Takeda and we are so happy we did. We will definitely be back to try new items on the menu. Service was quick and the decor was nice. It was so great to see a family operated restaurant. Sarah was so accommodating and even brought out some spicy tofu for us to try that she made for herself. If you are looking for some great Thai, give this place a try.

ASCV_llWlSHWM9tnoa8JXw.text: Just had dinner here with friends from Chicago and we all absolutely loved it. Moulay, the chef and owner is a star in the kitchen and in the restaurant. So personable and a True gentleman.  Everyone loved their entrees (my red chicken curry was so delicious) and we can't wait to go back. Wish I could give them 6 stars.

URXoIklxmJzwxZxE1sCddA.text: I love this place! Have been 2X + need to take my daughter who was in Thailand there when she is home from college! Moulay is an engineer by day and awesome chef in the evenings! I LOVE the GREEN curry (coconut milk base w/ green onion + chicken)! I had the spice level 2/4 and could have possible gone to a 3/4, having grown up in AZ & loving spicy food! Service was a bit slow (our drinks took a bit to arrive, then the food took longer), however everything is made upon ordering and I enjoyed visiting with friends. I love how Moulay's lovely wife (sorry I don't recall her name) made sure everyone had their orders as each wanted (~20 people...re-doing a couple of dishes) and she even created individual checks! Service was excellent! Thank you for a lovely evening! Awesome place!!! We will return!!!

mmfK1wATwtvvwHgbVxGh_g.text: Amazing flavors, great decor, and best of all chef/owner operated! Have thoroughly enjoyed everything I've ordered and specifically recommend tom ka, tom yum soups, spicy noodles, and trusting anything the staff recommends. You will enjoy and return. Good food, good people!

kTgdc_OhgVf_kP5LWNb2gA.text: Fell upon this restaurant by chance.  We were actually looking for an Indian restaurant.  Needless to say we were totally impressed!  It wasn't crowded so I was nervous and didn't know what to expect.  However, the blew me away with the service, food and ambiance. We chose the patio, quiet and unassuming.  It happened to be a beautiful evening so it was romantic for us.  We started with the lettuce wraps.  All I can say is "outstanding"!  I honestly felt like I was in another country!  The flavor was unlike anything I've had.  We also ordered a curry dish and we both ate it all up!  It was absolutely tasty!  We are not potato and carrots people so we left those behind but other than that it was also outstanding.  This restaurant is a diamond in the rough.  Don't hesitate if you're on the fence. I'm glad we did....we'll be back.  Thanks!!!

nIBVyen7T1GqJfsm8LAy1Q.text: Wonderful Thai food and atmosphere. The staff is always friendly and ready to go above and beyond to create a wonderful experience. The restaurant itself is cozy and romantic. For food, try the forbidden rice. It is superb! Pumpkin curry is delicious too, just make sure you can handle the spice!

SgvvB9znWhwqVxjrwYO9Hg.text: Food is great love his wok grilled edema me.  The forbidden rice is always a pleasure and his sauces are amazing.   3 stars because it's seriously overpriced for the portions you get.  I spend 15 bucks on lunch and leave hungry.    Very nice dining room and atmosphere.   Opens for lunch for 3 hours or so then closes till dinner.  Closed at weird times some days as well.  Knocked off a star for that too.    It is definitely worth trying and you be the judge on the price to portions.

F-G1yN0UFiNcHCa8X-MvZA.text: Outstanding service and food!  We found this place from Trip Advisor reviews and we're so glad we did. We had two different servers and they both went above and beyond to make us feel like valued customers; this is hard to find these days.  Everything is made fresh after you order. We had two of their specialty curries with tofu: mango curry and pumpkin curry. They were so fresh and delicious, the best curries we've ever had. Great atmosphere and music and there's a nice little patio out front with tables as well. We can't wait to go back!

I1XtytRT_45_XP9ybuofXQ.text: There were things in the Laad Nar noodles that I have never tasted before. And those things were delicious. I could have poured the gravy into a cup and drank it straight. And of course the ingredients themselves were all cooked to perfection, with a nice crunch still in the vegetables.    The staff are excellent, and the chef and owner stopped over at our table multiple times to help us choose food and see how everything was, even during the dinner rush.

-GEPBjQlhTJE1Djt0RBGqA.text: This review is for lunch only. The sevice and food quality is just fine. I ordered the yellow curry chicken lunch special and it was very flavorful. I ordered it spicy 4 out of 5 and it was pretty tame. Heat seekers order the 5. The portions were disappointing. Hot and sour soup served in a tea cup, really? My entree contained maybe 4 small wafer thin pieces of chicken. It came with a reasonable amount of rice, no suprise there. I'm not looking for a gut busting portion by any means but tea cup sized

bYGoh2EgbGjJNDdrBuyv1g.text: If u haven't stopped in here you r missing a treat. Every meal prepared for each customer. The sauces are out of this world.

4ECH_ng6avBVMcjQ7OnemA.text: This place is my favorite Thai restaurant in the Valley. Let me give you a run down on my visit. As I am walking in I immediately spot the herb garden in the front. We get seated and our waitress takes our drink order. Comes back, drops our drinks off after about 5 minutes. Leaves and comes back a few minutes later to take our appetizer order. We order a Spicy Edamame. Super, super tasty and it is certainly spicy. Thank goodness we were properly taken care of with a glass pitcher of water for us to refill when we needed. After we finished our appetizer our waitress takes our dinner order. I order the spicy noodles, with vegetables instead of chicken (level 3 spicy). Do you see the trend here? Each visit by our waitress was individually catered to a specific need. She didn't take our order while dropping off the appetizer; instead we enjoyed each order. This visit was certainly about the experience--and I loved it because we were celebrating a birthday.   The food was homemade--everything, even the noodles. The spices were grown in her garden and the dessert was absolutely fab; homemade coconut ice cream and friend bananas for the table to share. The guest I was with was celebrating a birthday so the owner brought him a drink which was a combination of a mojito and a margarita (Basil-rita), and yes, it, too, was made with fresh basil from her garden. It was delightful.  So this place gets 5 very bright stars. The owners came up to our table, talked to us and gave us a mini version of the story behind the place and the waitress was full of life and energy.    The place wasn't noisy and it was the atmosphere was not what I expected from the outside. I will return very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thai cocktails. Anything with the name &#34;dirty hot&#34; has my vote !!!
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy edamame.
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade coconut ice cream and fried banana.  Yum.

js0PWs0REyYbhEh1vnk1yQ.text: I love bringing my 2 boys, ages 7 and 9 to dinner at Takedathai for mom's night off.  The kids loved the fried tofu and pot sticker dumplings and side of broccoli.  Healthy dinner for them and curry for me! I love take out at lunch for me and hubby: chicken spicy noodles and green curry plus yum Nua (beef salad).  Thank you Moulay!

iD0gLGJeNMmMFik3KFdddw.text: Service issues. Especially with the assistant/bus boy/food runner guy, who seemed new and didn't speak English.  The supposedly spicy Uncle dish was ordered Thai Hot but served Mild. Bartender had to bring out some hotter chilis, which were good but changed the flavor.   Small portions. Pricey. Great wok-edamame. Awful satay. Other things were flavorful. Nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Uncle Som&#39;s Pad Ped with extra veggies. Ordered &#39;Thai Hot&#39; but came out MILD! Had to have gal put much more peppers in.
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ivp1bsmqMtr6C48nnlpscg.text: Food is overrated! The papaya salad was awful, 2 stars for the pad thai. The food portions are small for the price. I will never be back here .

BlYloTryum5BD3dBF5KpaQ.text: Had a great time at Takeda Thai. We sat on the patio since we had 2 dogs. It was very intimate and enjoyable. We had the pot sticker appetizers the masoman curry accompanied by mango mojitos. Moulay and his wife were very nice and great at hosting and serving! Will definitely be back next time we are in Scottsdale!

2GGNEgoPYsK06QnR_KJxvA.text: This little restaurant could be overlooked as it sits slightly hidden in a strip mall, but don't be fooled!! The food is outstanding and it is decorated so cute both in the main area, bar and the small patio by the herb garden.  The patio is where we chose to dine and it was so nice and relaxing!  We had attentive but not overbearing service and thoroughly enjoyed getting to know the owner(s) Ms. Sarah Takeda and also really enjoyed our chat with Moulay himself!   But of course we were there for food! Sarahs recommendations were on point!  We really enjoyed the Coconut soup (cant remember the official name) and my husband was delighted that he got to have sweet and sour chicken!  A rare treat when you are gluten free, the chicken isn't breaded and the sauce isnt overly sweet=PERFECT!  We also enjoyed a dish of homemade coconut ice cream and oh.....I almost forgot the Thai tea with RUM!!  YUM!!!

P4SN8-oGm20pbNoAEvmZAA.text: How I ever missed this place when they opened years ago is beyond me. It is one of our go to places now. The food isn't just good, it's great. Try their pad Thai. Unlike other places it doesn't matter if it's dine in or take out, the food is consistent and flavorful. Make sure you branch out and try different things or eat family style sharing dishes. One thing to note is the dishes aren't huge but about average size to feed one person.  It is a little more on the expensive size in relation to the amount of food you get. If you are looking for a nicer Thai restaurant to eat at with consistent quality and taste I doubt you will find one.

AFXqD5Dax8ieHxQyuV79Og.text: Any place that plays uninterrupted French Cafe radio is a hit with me. Set the mood for a wonderful evening with my sisters and my mom and son.  The coconut milk creamy thai soup, with shrimp and mushrooms was phenomenal. It had an excellent amount of thai basil, lemongrass and was deliciously savored.    The chai tea and the jasmine tea were a hit with my son.   My sisters like the spicier tastes, and Chef Moulay brought out different spices for them to try. Luckily for them, they had drinks to cool their palates off with.  My mom eats just enough for a bird to get by on, but she LOVED the charred veggies and rice. She needs to try the forbidden rice next time.  We enjoyed the Sunday evening, it was a great time with family, and we think we found a nice place to return to when we are all in town again.

WvtGzMAScqkqoiH3yMZa2Q.text: This is the best Thai restaurant I have been to in Scottsdale or Phoenix or Tempe!!! The food is outstanding nding. Matching the food, the decor and music are classy and stylish. Mouley, the owner is so fun. All I can say is run don't walk to this gem!!!

dh7XzjYAq0oT8LMhwjU3tg.text: The food and atmosphere here are fabulous!  The owner is very personable and professional.  When we arrived for dinner, it was nearly closing time.  The owner welcomed us with open arms and made us a delicious meal (5 stars!!).  You have to try the coconut ice cream (if you have room in your tummy).  It was made right there at the restaurant.  Everything is made fresh and to order.  I had the Thai basil stir-fry which had crisp and fresh veggies.  My hubby had the fire-cracker chicken- very delicious!  Please stop by this gem of a restaurant and enjoy!

zbzZcpVeGpISI2uQDfSDEw.text: This restaurant is by far the best in the state. I was able to have an amazing lunch with friends and business meeting.

fwr24ZP2aryPGdGNWodoLA.text: I have nothing but kind words and love for this restaurant and the amazing people that are apart of it. Moulay is generous, kind, fun and an all around good person to know. On top of the human element, is the amazing food the team produces. From the apps, to the curries, to the BEST Pad Thai in town...you cannot miss an opportunity to dine at this local spot.

60ssnypyCqbINFVbxZO9hw.text: This is a late post but very much needed. My boyfriend and I decided to check them out since they are walking distance away. If you get the Thai  craving, don't expect anything special from Takeda Thai. Our bill was $45.57 for TWO People. That's a little high for tiny portions and subpar flavor. They charge $3.99 for Thai tea! Without telling you if there are refills and their famous coconut ice cream? Is a joke. We got two baby scoops that were the equivalent of a tablespoon for $7.95. After we were done, our waiter took close to 40 mins to close is out because he was busy talking at the bar. This place needs a lot of work and better management. They also need to lower the prices. The $45.57 would be worth it if it was amazing food and service, but they fell very short. Save your money and keep looking for another Thai venue

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not worth the money, this was two people craving Thai!!!

oQTtuTdQoP93mfKMZpIK2A.text: Beautiful decor plus all the dishes we ordered were full of flavor and delicious! Glad we found this place, will definitely be coming back and telling everyone about it!

e8bUpil_poFYWp9WBqtnew.text: We've been coming here for years. Mouley takes good care of us and everyone we bring along. Spicy edamame is terrific--I'd love to figure out how they do it. Charred veggies is a dish I dream about. Hubby adores fried rice.  This is a wonderful neighborhood place. It's hard to find, but worth it!

NskuvVQbtH2BEOX_-x6v4A.text: This place has incredible food!!!  I tried the roti (highly recommend) and potstickers as appetizers, had some of the best red curry ever, and the coconut ice cream was a great way to end a great meal.  Highly recommend you check this place out!!  Fabulous!!! :-)

9xwDR9WYHjhc_LGH-rS4eQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. My first reactions were a bar counter that had not been cleaned off. I sat with dirty plates next to me for over 30 minutes. My menu arrives promptly but with sticky residue all over it.   There was one food runner and one server/bartender and while it is not a big place, he stood and talked to what I can only assume were "regulars" for so long that other guests were neglected. I wanted a Thai beer but thought I would try one of their cocktails and order the beer with my meal. I was finished with my meal before he saw me staring him down and then I sat drinking my beer while not enjoying food with it. I also wasn't offered chopsticks or even a knife so I was awkwardly pushing the food around on the plate with just a fork.   The red curry that I got was very delicious - I read online that they don't make the food spicy so I ordered it "Thai hot" and even with the ultimate spicy option, it was so so spicy.   After my meal, I sat for over 15 minutes waiting for a box/check/acknowledgement.

nZe-wFl0OE5Ni9oP1zxO6w.text: Yellow curry was great, the service was even better! The owner/chef came out to talk to us and it was a pleasure. What a friendly and welcoming character. We'll definitely be back!

h_0NjwTyk7mERK1PsqzKAw.text: My favorite Thai in Scottsdale.  Excellent food and really great food.  Nice environment too.

l_uIO1XtU2AZyMaMWh1Zlw.text: Food was amazing! The appetizers gave us a chance to gauge their spice levels (1-4). Everything was delicious. Then the main courses came out and were perfect! No one was unhappy with the spice or flavor of their dishes, and most were blown away!  Service and staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

mK4V-7v3OevBOikoz5FwMA.text: I usually don't leave negative reviews but oh my gosh! This was the worst experience ever! I came in a little late to meet my family and the waitress wouldn't even look at me to offer me some water. She was only interested in their orders I suppose?? After I mentioned I'd like a drink she walked back to get water and slammed it down on the table half full and warm. My family and I looked around and it appeared she was the only server working on a Friday night???? Way understaffed and dirty dishes and drinks lined the entire bar!! Not one clean table. We were shocked! The owner came over as we looked a little annoyed and mentioned "I'm the owner, we are busy, would you like to move?" We prob all looked confused and simply replied "no?" Which was extremely strange? After that the additional chef/owner/manager came out from the kitchen and strait up demanded what the problem was. After trying to mention they needed more staff and it was a little dirty he cut us off yelling "do not interrupt me!" I was in utter shock. He then proceeded to say we should be grateful he cooked 200 meals himself and he was doing the best he could??? Umm... what?? Get some more help! Be prepared for a weekend shift? He was about 2 inches from our face explaining we were in the wrong. I have never in my life been in such an uncomfortable situation. I would never go back here due to the verbal abuse and out of line staff. Great food... HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!! Ahhhhh!!!

_B9Op4tmfVFdkP6jQZsLDw.text: This is my favorite place to eat!!!!  The food is amazing!  Such good flavor!  The Penang curry with the forbidden rice is my very favorite meal. The place is a little off the beaten path but so worth the stop!

L2DiJRdcx6zf5dBe-7NPXQ.text: Ordered a takeaway meal for me and my wife. The lady said 35 minutes. Went there after 35 minutes and had to wait 15 minutes at the bar... although the restaurant was not full  My wife ordered a mild spicy meal and it was very spicy... the food was okayish but insufficient quantity. Overall I was disappointed with quality price ratio.

_0aBjsoLcRUMKoT_9TSCfQ.text: Great awesome lovedit!!! Absolutely enjoyed my food. It was literally created for me. Had hot and sour soup which was very tasty and i went on to almost finish the bowl. Next ordered roti and pumpkin curry, it was a lil sweet but wth the soup on the sidevit tasted great. Im so glad to have found this place, it is a Gem in scottsdale. Best Thai food i have had in Phoenix. Ordered a level 4 spuce level for rhe soup and trust me it was seriously level 4. Next time i can do level 3 but i am so going back again

sHzXyXxNdgBmvTBXCddupw.text: This place should be 5 stars based on their food alone! Amazing !! Will def start being a regular!

r2OZhLA7CPxVvw00DE_TqQ.text: Recently dined here with a friend. The chef/owner was wonderful.  So charming and friendly.  Food was excellent.

WtbY5yobMAPkFwsN1Dylvw.text: We stopped by for an early dinner. The place was dark and eerie. The waitress was not friendly at all. They may have good food, but the atmosphere and the poor service was a turn off.

hn17CCD7U6_o8Bym8x553Q.text: I've been fortunate to enjoy great Thai cooking in Atlanta, Chicago, New York, Los Angeles and London. This place totally rates way up there. The food was fresh, classic and prepared to the exact level of slickness I requested. I'm psyched about the location, which is close to our new home in Scottsdale. Easy parking. Classy decor. Heck yeah, I'm going to make this place a regular haunt.   Oh, and one more thing: I ordered my food on a Sunday at closing time. No problem. They kept the kitchen open for me and gave me fantastic service.

4nZ_2wRkjNAH6DCPwdItCQ.text: Some of the best Thai food I've had both in and out of Thailand!! The Tom Kah Gai is out of this world. The exec chef was amazingly helpful and awesome with the kids. You can't go wrong with this place if you are looking for authentic Thai good at it's finest in a super friendly atmosphere. Will come back again and again!!!

ZAmdrEBgGLNcFCPcKPECtQ.text: Choose your spice 0-4.  3=hot, 4=Thai hot.  I think any Thai place you go you might as well put a Thai qualifier in front of all spice levels bc it's always hotter than asked for.  My 0 spice curry was thus Thai 0 spice, as it definitely still had a kick.  Not too bad, but enough to be bothersome when you have inflammation and are real sensitive to spice and emphasize NO SPICE. Anyway, enough of that rant, it looks like there are some quality items on this menu but it's very expensive.  My yellow curry was $14 for a medium sized portion and was just okay.  At other places in the area I have gotten the same quality curry in twice the portion size for cheaper.  If you really want to spend, they have some delicious-sounding specialty dishes that run around $25+ (e.g. grilled curried salmon or roasted duck dishes).  Anyway, that's not me at my age and budget.   Overall, my impression was a Thai restaurant with a nice atmosphere that wants to present a fine dining experience but the food is just slightly above average.  Of course I've only had one dish, so make your own judgment on the food.  I would say that this place would be great for a date night if you are willing to spend some money.  Very nice atmosphere.

aRJWnF6yYLRi7I5xiTB_kw.text: Been there twice now...  Pro's - soup that comes with the lunch special is really tasty - the two dish's I've had we're good but a little dry (leaving as a pro just because the taste and quality is good) - nice cozy atmosphere  Con's - potential for slow service  Let me explain the one con I made.  The two times I have been there there appears to be only one server for the whole restaurant (at least at lunch).  He did great, but I did wait a smidge though;  that's my issue since I and others probably are conditioned for blazing fast service.  So be patient, the food and the fella doing the serving are good.

OMqavUX7v0pH1WHk45Hg7g.text: Absolutely excellent fresh and flavorful food!!!!!  Their Cousin of Pho is unique and amazingly delicious! Spice level of entrees was the perfect amount of hot....not too overpowering but with a spicy kick all the same. Can't wait return for a meal.

qTflVLunsZpjXkn5ihuomg.text: Excellent food. Great service. Owned by a couple that truly loves their customers and cares about what's on the plate. Music is good, home made ice cream (coconut) is a great finish. Spicy noodles with Thai basil was awesome. I also had the green curry which was delicious. Definitely going back.

gNHgMgTGAeQSTGaJ948tRQ.text: It doesn't have the obligatory framed picture of the Thai royal family on the wall but I'm wiling to let it slide.  This menu offers a fresh take on the solid staples that we love.  I love the Pad Thai  here and not just because it is endorsed by Howard Seftel.

mYezrG3WfmJW68MCU6xlzw.text: Best Thai restaurant in Scottsdale by a mile. Everything made fresh and it comes across in the flavor of each dish I've had here. Excellent owner and staff, friendly and helpful, always interested in producing a great meal and atmosphere. Come here when you have time to relax and really enjoy the meal.

dQtW3ywl6yBxEyxqqCL1cw.text: Excellent food, but service was atrocious.  Only visiting on vacation, but if I lived around here I would NOT come back.

z1G2KvrRztps3XnYD1Cwyg.text: Had dinner here on a Friday night. The exterior looks mysterious and exotic. When we walked in, we saw a sign to wait to be seated but no one immediately came to seat us.. Eventually a gentleman, who I assume is the owner, sitting with some patrons came up and sat us. Besides him there was only one waiter so the service was quite slow. We got the lettuce wraps with larb ga to start. The larb was tasty but the lettuce was small chunks of romaine that was mostly just the core. For mains we got the red curry and panang curry which tasted really similar. I thought they were both mediocre. The consistency was on the runny side. The portions are fairly large so that was an upside.

-PaOHKGGfsm_SmlAOFK6CQ.text: Seriously  We walked in and were the only ones in the place except for two people at the bar. We were seated by some one in Chef's attire. No one bothered with us for 15 min-we ultimately timed it The individual who seated us was looking periodically right at us A young lady flitted back and forth-bar patron vs  Employee   At any rate we ultimately walked out  Admittedly my wife and myself are in our sixties. The idiot who runs this place should know that means we have money and dine out frequently  Prediction: gone within six months

gEiYZN3-5_VLXbnub02Z3A.text: A really charming place.  I can't believe it's been here for two years!  The owner was so nice, and went as far as visiting each table and had great conversations with everyone in my party to ensure that our dining experience was as great as we had hoped.  Our food was great!  I loved the flavors here, and the dishes were all complex and True to their authentic roots.  I agree with the other reviews though, that this place needs more servers.  We were going out on a Saturday so our party was patient and more than happy to wait.  Had this been an intimate dinner date, I'd hope the pace would be quicker.  Most of that can be attributed to the fact that the place is short staffed.  Hopefully, people will visit this place and change that. :)

d03gkZQH92WxJtQroYlrZg.text: Takeda Thai is the best Thai Restaurant this side of the milky way........

ZI0Px4NAp0uibxZCGnG0xQ.text: After reading the reviews and ratings for this place, it sounded worth trying.  I had missed the review below about all the added costs and small portions.  I explained to the smarmy waiter that it was my first time here and asked for a suggestion and the Eggplant and Zucchini dish was great.  From there it went downhill.  He upsold the Forbidden Rice for 2.75 and made it sound like it was a choice that came with the entree.  I could have let that slide, but when I asked for the Fried Bananas for dessert, he came back at me with something about did I want the fried banana with coconut ice cream.  I said "yes" thinking that must be the ice cream they were serving with it.  The irresistible photo someone added here had 4 fried bananas drizzled with honey or something similar with a scoop of ice cream in the middle.  I got 2 very dry, fried bananas with such a tiny scoop of ice cream that they had to serve it with a very tiny dessert spoon.  When I looked at the bill, I had been charged 2.95 for the substitute of that tiny bite of coconut ice cream.  So I paid almost 11 dollars for this small, boring dessert!  (The outstanding Bananas Foster at Eddie V's is huge compared to this and might actually command the higher price, but the cost is much less.) The waiter seemed to think that their ice cream was something spectacular.  I don't eat a lot of ice cream but I've had coconut ice cream that was equal to or better than this.  All I can say is that by treating customers this way to make a few extra dollars on the bill, in my opinion, will do nothing but turn people away, especially locals.  I would have gone back because the atmosphere was nice and my main dish was pretty good, but I prefer to give my business to places that are genuine and honest.  There are other Thai restaurants I will try next time.  Sorry, Takeda Thai, you didn't earn my business.

eT1iMAhusJM8YUfMpcedXg.text: To start, the food was 5 stars.  It was just several other things that would keep me from going back.  Where do I start?   First, the only wine choices, (3) they have are all $11.00 a glass.  $11.00?!   Even very expensive restaurants have choices in the $8.00 range.  Some even less.  It's a very simple concept that Costco started....sell them for less and just sell more.  I'm sure the high dollar Scottsdale lease is very expensive but I would have had two 7.00 glasses....which makes 14.00.  That's 4.00 more then 11.00.  Very few people are going to have 2 glasses at that price....which for a couple is 44.00 worth of wine by the glass.    Next....we were a party of 6,  that's not a "large" party.  When they brought out our checks and we sent them back with our payment....when they return with the CC slips, they had added the gratuity.  Instead of adding it when they first brought the check out as everyone else does.  It felt like a bait and switch.  And 6 people, come on?   They added 20 percent to the full total even on the tax.   I would have tipped 15-18% naturally.   Next..... Our friends had a superfluous charge for brown rice....they hadn't ordered a side of brown rice.   They only ordered a side of white rice.  The brown rice side that was about 1/2 of a cup of rice was 2.75.   That was on top of an already 14.00 dish.  Really?  A dimes worth of rice for 2.75?  Just bring another side of rice if your patron isn't satisfied with the 1/2 cup that came with the 14.00 meal.  Just because.   And when my friend dared to ask the charge to be removed.....we all got the feeling she...we....were being thought petty.  I don't care if it's only one nickel over.....it's not YOUR nickel, it's the patrons.  They actually debated with her about it and I think it took two tries to get it off the bill.  She would have dropped it and paid it....no way. Next...I ordered a side of 7.00 crispy green beans.  When he went to write it down he repeated something completely different then what I said.  I caught it and asked.  He had instead ordered me a 14.00 meal that has  green beans.  The two sounded nothing alike.  I'm not sure how he confused that.  In any case, I conceded.  And later I was irritated I had. Next...I don't want to be told I'm having dessert.  I want to be asked. "Save room for the coconut ice cream".   How about "did anyone save room for dessert".  When we replied that we were maybe going to have dessert at the Maverick coffee house next door we were told "that place is closed".   And it wasn't.  To be fair, normally it is closed at that time but it was open for a special event.  But it was still an abrupt weird reply. We were a party of 6 and another table of 2 who were also connected with the special event at the Maverick were in the restaurant that night.     Other than that there was another 6 or so people in there in the time frame that we were there. So...had the special event not have been going on....half the people there wouldn't have been there. The main problem I think is the price.  Thai food should be reasonable.  Usually is.  Even high end like Wild Thaiger on Central has dishes mostly in the 9-12 dollar range.  And 8.00 glasses of wine.  And is way hipper design wise then this place is. Although it's nice in there.    So my advice.......they need to adjust the prices, get better wine options price wise and keep making that wonderful food and they'll  be packed out on a Friday night at 8:00.    They won't need to upsell or charge for a extra side of rice or haggle over 2.75.  People want the Trifecta.....fabulous food, prices and service.   That's called Durants.  It's very upscale but worth every penny.......they have a 6.00 glass of wine if I'm not mistaken.   And I spent 91.00 tax and tip for 2 people to eat rice and sauce.....I could have gone to Durants.  Durants lets you spilt a 28 oz. slab of meat and it comes with a extra set of sides for only 5.00 more....and they tell you that when you say your going to "split".  That's why 60 years later they are still around and packed out.  You can't walk in on a Friday or Saturday usually. We shall see how Takeda fares.  And I disagree with Yelp...it's 3 $$$, not 2.  Especially since its Thai. Another positive....the person who I think was the owner but wasn't waiting on us was very nice and welcoming.

rL-UmfJYPZssMsg7VjXpLQ.text: Best Thai food in Arizona hands down! I've been going since they opened back in 2008 and they're just as consistent today as they were then. Every dish I've had there (which is almost all of them) has been amazing. Don't pass this place up, it's amazing!

jAFIgYK6leKtiqpz8m48zQ.text: My girlfriend and me walked in over 90 minutes before closing on a Saturday night and waited at the front for 10 minutes while several servers passed by and said nothing. Finally a server approached to let us know they were no longer serving new tables and quickly turned around....... There were 10 tables available and at least 5 servers on staff.......  Are you F-ing kidding me!?!?!?  What is wrong with this establishment????   Train your people better, tell them to at least make something up. Here let me help. After noticing we were standing there going unnoticed, they should have said something like," I am so sorry you've been waiting however unfortunately we ran out of rice, chicken, and beef and can no longer serve another customer tonight, PLEASE come back!".....  Worst experience ever.

4onBK65PTNqs7O4_SrcvOQ.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place because I absolutely love Thai! I walked in just before 8pm and was literally flat out IGNORED by every single server on the floor for 12 minutes. They would walk right by me standing there and not even make eye contact. It got to the point where I could tell the 4 tables in there noticing how strange it was that the servers were acting like I was invisible. After the 12 minutes of feeling like chopped liver, a girl came up to me and said "we aren't sitting any more tables tonight". Oh thanks for telling me 12 minutes later while I just awkwardly stood there watching all of you walk past me. And no sorry? What the? I was a server for yearssss and I could not even imagine ignoring someone for that long at the door.   It's a shame to be treated like that 2 hours before the closing time on a Saturday night....Everyone save your time and go to Thai house or Totties Fusion right down the road.

8u6GHXOb8zw-YUBAw_5zhg.text: I'd give 0 stars if I could. By far the worst service I've ever had. We waited 30 minutes for someone to even come over after we were sat and ask if we wanted drinks and another 20-30 minutes for them to get our food order. Then half our table didn't even have drinks/water and I had to actively grab our waiter's attention to get anything done. I watched another table get sat, wait 20 minutes without being served, and walk out after being forgotten about. Our server got the order wrong and getting any refills or additional drinks was up to us to go up to the bar or grab another server. I feel bad because I could tell that the guy with the beard was working hard, but he is frankly not cut out for the service industry. I would've tipped less if the gratuity wasn't already automatically included in our tab. I've honestly never seen anything as bad as this. I just want to clarify that it takes exceptionally bad service for me to go out of my way to write such a negative review.

FyMy8TpllwVsJ3GQ6tht5A.text: This place is always great. I recommend their eggplant curry. It's incredible.  Moulay is the head chef and owner and always takes care of his guests. He treats everyone like family and it's always amazing being here.  It's a secret spot that has a cult following. I'm sure I'll see you there soon!

IEj9eI268mJNcBkOsefpXA.text: This is the best Thai food I have ever eaten. Thai Basil & Pad Thai were both amazing & the homemade coconut ice cream was wonderful too! I will definitely return soon and will highly recommend this restaurant to my friends.

rhuiSc1qonpLkjXRGTFt4w.text: Go for the food!! Seriously this is hands down the best Thai food in all of Scottsdale/Phoenix!! And, YES, I have eaten at nearly every Thai place in the valley...  I have had exceptional service even when the place is packed and extra busy. In fact, I recently went with a friend visiting AZ with a 2-year old child.  The owner went out of his way to make sure the child was happy and occupied with food to keep her happy.  As for the spice issue I just read the review-- not everyone can handle spice and I am often asking for additional chills and peppers to enhance my food, I just know to ask for it THAI HOT now. For those who do not tolerate any spice, I have seen the kitchen send out very mild and wonderfully flavored food for my friends who have sensitive taste buds.  Raves and accolades each time!  Let's just get into the food-- The quality of the ingredients used are always fresh.  I have ordered many dishes on the menu and have made substations that have all be delivered with a smile. The soups are divine, the papaya salad is almost as good as when I was on the beach on Thailand-- BTW, I spent three months in Thailand and have a minor obsession with Thai food...  At first glance the seafood dishes look pricey, but once you try any of the dishes you will taste the quality that you are paying for!  The standards-- Green Curry, Pad Thai, and others are spot on delish! Uncle Som's Pad Ped makes my mouth water for days after... The spicy edamame rocks!! The home made coconut ice cream-- YUMM!  The bar is well stocked, although the wine list is pretty Meh... All the great Thai beers and a few others too.  Here is where you will find a kind, honest, hard working owner who makes the very best and most authentic Thai food in the valley.  If you want the best Thai you must try this place. You will be greatly impressed with the quality of food, preparation, and the taste of each dish you order.   If you really enjoy Thai food and want a high quality food experience this is your spot!  Since you will be back many times after you try, I look forward to meeting you at this amazing Thai place.

wfm_WxfM9F_ZiqWntM13Ag.text: I've been here several times and thought it was time to finally write a review. I must say this is my favorite Thai restaurant in Scottsdale.  For curry, I think the Mango Curry is my favorite. Mix of spicy curry and sweetness of mango mixed together to create yummy dish. I ordered extra rice and finished the curry sauce.  It was just spicy enough, my Thai tea helped me sooth spiciness in my mouth.  I tried two different types of fried rice.  They both were good, but I think I liked Korobe fried rice. It doesn't look like standard fried rice you see in any Chinese restaurant, but it taste like authentic fried rice I ate somewhere in Asia.  There are so many other dishes I haven't tried yet. Can't wait to come back to try them all soon.

RuXynBpKU5ngR_P2v3rH4Q.text: Best Thai Food in town hands down. The sauces are amazing. Love the panang, green curry, pad Thai, eggplant, edamame. Take out or dine in love it all!

VUStB6CXEluf5hsL5PEkmw.text: This is a cute little shop in a strip mall - the guy who waited on us was a jack of all trades, helping in the kitchen as well as handling everything out front.  He was as friendly as could be, and I loved giving him the business.  The food was pretty average Thai (nothing special).  If I go back, it will be because of this guy (the owner?), and not the food.  I like supporting small businesses. The food was perfectly adequate for lunch, but no better than some of it's competition.

Xs7PDyVHH-IMoQgflNN5nQ.text: Just stumbled on this great Thai place.  Nice atmosphere and very friendly & attentive staff.  Food was excellent. Had some spring rolls and the larb gai lettuce wraps for an appetizer and the Pad Thai and the Chicken Mango Curry as our entrees.  Delicious! Great flavors!  For the spice level we took 1 (out of 4) and it was spicy enough for us.  We definitely will be back!!!

gqeS9ieqpBAe9OZUNAlhqg.text: It's 100 degrees and monsoon season.  Air conditioning is a requirement.  This place got great ratings but we had to leave.

nj0jph9-V2y6CIfFN7eL-A.text: Some pf the best Thai food we've had and we've had it in London and all over the US. Wide range of soft background music but I would suggest sitting near the patio doors if you need extra light to read the menu.  Nice choice of appetizers, soups and main courses with 4 heat choices. The owner, Moulay, was the server and brought us a two complementary pot stickers along with our order of Crackling wok charred Edamame.  We usually have Pad which was the best we've had.  As we were leaving another couple we coming in and when I told them the food was great the obviously were locals because the said Moulay was great.

N84zKm1RVYdtlwACr-Jaaw.text: Delicious food and everyone was extremely courteous. Will definitely be coming back here again.

vt61JJvrOtoN74juG9joFQ.text: Enjoyed my pad thai! Friendly service and nice atmosphere. I would go back.

C8sa0HHsOJJXx3Uc38RQ6w.text: I have now had the spicy noodle dish twice. It may be the best dish I have ever eaten. I'm not just talking about Thai, I'm talking about anything. I did it with fried tofu vs chicken or beef or shrimp or whatever because I'm vegan. Absolutely positively amazing.  If you like Thai food, this is absolutely the place to go.

Xn0V_9pXuqGnAZhBnO0QoA.text: We did take out and the service was very fast. I would have happily dined in as the atmosphere is so pretty. Great prik king, pad thai with shrimp and forbidden rice. Can't wait to go back.

-j8al79dxl4pXwdsLPKKRg.text: One of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Loved my Thai basil margarita and Thai basil story fry (hot level 1).  Nicholas was friendly and attentive.  Go there...a hidden gem In the back of a strip center. P.S...they have a herb garden out front they use for their drinks and dishes.

fCFCfu1qY2M9XAxBeDOMrw.text: Excellent food!  Especially the Tom Ka Gai coconut soup.  The lighting was very dim which I love.  Wish I had discovered this place long ago.  It's hard to find really, really good Thai food.  This place is number one on my list now.

rirLEyfAhbkMLTDZ1WjaTA.text: I was vacationing from California with my boyfriend. We wanted to grab a quick bite to eat before heading over to topgolf. I was craving some Thai food and found this place on yelp. Thank you Yelpers! you absolutely did not steer me wrong when it came to Takeda Thai. The service was amazing, we had the friendliest server who was such a delight, and the FOOD was on another level. We keep joking now that arizona Thai has ruined it for us because we will never find Thai food in California that's comparable. A M A Z I N G. I'll be dreaming of takeda until my next trip to Arizona!

xakf09YK19Eu7hROaN7q-w.text: Sadly, I only just went for the first time last week, despite living a short walk a way for the past three years. I suppose this is due to general dissatisfaction with the state of Asian restaurants of all kinds in Phoenix/Scottsdale. They seem to be very hit or miss, and it seems like people out here don't know any better. Suffice to say, my experience today made me regret my not giving at Takeda Thai a chance earlier.   First, the food was great. Thai food is usually good but not great. I ordered the soup after I heard a passerby raving about it. It was rave-worthy. I also ordered drunken noodles (pad ki mao). The waiter (who turned out to be the owner, Moulan), did not bat an eye, and the food came quickly. The noodles were also amazing. I ordered them with beef, which turned out to be tender, appropriately-seasoned top sirloin. They don't have cheap beef there apparently. They charge $3.50 extra for this but it is a no-brainier--get it anyway. Moulan also brought some sort of thin egg roll (?) thing which was also fantastic. Imo it was fresh made; I would be shocked if it came frozen off a truck like many restaurants serve around here.   Second, the service was absolutely fantastic. Moulan is great. He has wonderful manners, and is very charming and friendly. After I learned he was from Morocco I asked if he could make Moroccan mint tea. I regretted this immediately because I've heard it is a PITA to make, and started to reconsider, but he would not have it. Do I even need to say the tea was amazing--the genuine article.   Third, despite being in a *slightly* aging retail area (SE corner of Scottsdale and Shea), the ambiance was great. I sat outside on their enclosed patio with beautiful brick flooring. It is not apparent to me that any expense was spared in making the place look great. Needless to say, everything was also spotlessly clean.  Usually people say something bad here to balance out the review, and I would if I had anything bad to say, but I don't. This place is definitely going to the top of my rotation, and I would recommend it to anyone. I had the best dining experience I've had in recent memory there today, and it was only lunch time!

o4XKpyTdQC0LjVYRNtEuBQ.text: So I'm a retired chile researcher among other things. Their heat scale goes from 1-5. They said some crazy man asked for 45. Not to be outdone I went 60. Incredible! Soups, lettuce rolls (Laarb), spicy noodles, homemade coconut ice cream etc and every dish we've had is authentic, tasty and served by the friendliest people imaginable (Sarah).  Don't just go there, run there. It's a beautiful place too.

oLTo-m-vrGgE60xI0vxBBw.text: Takeda Thai is the best Thai food I have found in Scottsdale. The restaurant has a fantastic ambiance and the owners are both very friendly and attentive. They have a great variety of items on the menu and the dishes are very reasonably priced. The website takedathai.com has a coupon for 10% off your entire meal. Go there, eat, and enjoy!

v-WTpxYzt_aRaxJTVf25IA.text: Went with some friends last night after reading the rave reviews about it in the Phoenix Magazine. The decor is super cute from the outside and the inside. Our server was very nice and extremely helpful. The presentation of the food was really nice but the food was no better than other Thai food I have had. We started with the pot stickers. They were small but with six per the order, they were tasty. We ordered the green curry, yellow curry, Tom khai Gha soup, and the Pad See Ew noodles for dinner. All were good. I am not a huge spice person but I tasted no heat at level 2 and thought level 3 was too hot. But, it may just be me. We had fun and will most likely go back if we get a craving for Thai.

cHcqRjvVo4Dn_Yag8ils5Q.text: This restaurant is pretty...but not dazzling as some other reviewers have indicated.  When we came here on a Saturday night, I was surprised to see that other patrons had clearly put on their best sparkley outfits just to dine here.  This is in a strip mall, people.  Perhaps I'm spoiled by the many upscale Asian restaurants in Minneapolis where you can eat, drink, dance, mingle and lounge in your best outfit all night long.  On to the food... First of all, why doesn't Takeda Thai have fresh spring rolls?  This was my first disappointment.  I settled for the lettuce wraps for my appetizer instead - which they happily veganized for me - making it with with tofu rather than chicken.  The flavors and textures were really blah though.  I wouldn't recommend that appetizer to anyone. I shared my main entree with my boyfriend, not realizing how teeny-tiny the serving would be.  We had the Thai Basil with tofu.  The flavors were amazing.  Although,sadly, the entire dish was made up of about 6 pieces of tofu and 6 thin slices of red pepper.  I would've been a lot more impressed with this dish if there were more vegetables involved.  When the dish was set in front of us, I actually felt misled by the menu's description.   I also think the up-charge for brown rice here is a little ridiculous...but at least they offer it. Our server was spectacular.  He knew we were in from out of town and did his best to impress us.  At the end of our meal, he asked us how we enjoyed ourselves, and I didn't have the heart to tell him that Yelp's phrase was ringing in my head..."meh, I've experienced better".

WTRyG9Ocu3-gVF0phDvfMw.text: The food here is simply amazing! The service is fantastic. The owners do a great job of getting to know you and cater to your hunger. The pad thai and curries are so delicious. I love coming here with my family. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a great and fun time as they eat phenomenal food.

1k5BEMqJjCFASYKUSm65mA.text: Concierge suggested this place.  What a great suggestion!  Went with my wife and another couple.  We all ordered something different and all shared at the waiter's suggestion.  Waiter, Peter, was a terrific waiter and gave us excellent service.  All food is made fresh so it takes a few minutes but is worth the wait.  We ordered the pad Thai, firecracker chicken, mango curry, pad prik.  All four were great. We ordered them in a couple of heat levels just to see the difference.  Two is nice and spicy three is pretty hot. We've been to some great Thai places in NJ & NY and this place is just as good.  If you like Thai, don't miss this place

Z35vEZJZe6jML9sQE7zpIg.text: The food here is delicious, fresh, with high quality ingredients.  They do not skimp out here.  I always order the pot stickers. the wrapper is very nice and tenderly steamed. The dumpling on the inside lacks a little bit of flavor, but to me, that's okay, because the dipping sauce that comes with it is so good and well balanced with acidity and spicy chilies. I LOVE LOVE LOVE their Red Curry with chicken. I like it pretty spicy, but if you don't they can make it any way you want it. They also give you extra chili sauce on the side that you can add. The jasmine rice here is perfectly cooked and fragrant. If you drink here your bill can add up pretty quick. It isn't inexpensive, but for the quality it is worth it. The restaurant is in a strip mall and you would never know it's there otherwise. When you walk in through the curtains, it is a quaint space with asian decor. The staff is stellar and very helpful with the menu if you have questions about anything.

hfYi0Eu_4eY5FWtSFOqF-w.text: Takeda Thai is delish!!! I've been eating here for two years now and I can't get enough of their food! As a person of Thai decent, I have been to Thailand numerous times and the authentic food that is served at this restaurant really gives me that 'homey' feeling. Also, I can't say enough about how beautiful this restaurant is!! Although it is tucked away in an older/less-flashy part of Scottsdale, this cozy restaurant is decorated with classic Thai art which provides a wonderfully romantic and classy ambiance. Such a great date-place! :) Anyway, as far as food is concerned.. I haven't found a dish that I don't LOVE- the curry is on point (all flavors), firecracker chicken is to die for, pad-thai is a classic, and the thai basil and spicy noodles are delish!! Any of those paired with a Thai iced tea or Thai beer is a sure bet!! ALSO- If you're looking for an EXTRA SPECIAL TREAT- try the HOMEMADE coconut ice cream or banana spring rolls! DELISH DELISH!

csIhC4MlNPCn1D7RTkcfSQ.text: Stopped by here while passing through Phoenix based on the reviews here and elsewhere.  Top-notch Thai food in a very elegant setting.   The owner/hosts couldn't have been more wonderful.

GRHoOWxQf-Vvales4Mml8g.text: Best Thai food hands down!!!! I had the pleasure of meeting the owners and love them! All of the food is fresh and made exactly to order. I love the egg rolls! Everything I've ordered has been delicious. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants! I'm always bringing guests when they come to town!!

13kfoCDaLQXtrSkzHWVKQw.text: Takada Thai is an answer to my prayers, a great Thai restaurant in my zip code!  The food is excellent, the people are friendly and gracious, the prices are fair.  What more could you ask for?  Oh yeah, atmosphere, it has plenty of it, is decorated wonderfully and is quiet and nice and just a great place for lunch or dinner.  I take all my business clients there and they are always pleasantly surprised.  Tim

SU92J-x7PJOS8QD-slpfdg.text: Takeda Thai has always been a consistent, great place to enjoy dining at.  I've had the pleasure of having both lunch and dinner there, multiple times, and have yet to be disappointed.  Their pad thai, soups, chicken  and fish entrees are incredible.  The food is very fresh, served with a smile and presented perfectly.  The banana dessert is wonderful, too.  The atmosphere is comfortable, the service is great and the food is delicious.  What more could a patron want when they are dining out?  I like the fact that whether you are dining alone or eating with other people you receive a genuine warm greeting when you walk in the door, receive top notch customer service and wonderful food.   Moulay and Sarah have done a fantastic job with this restaurant.  They are truly passionate about Takeda Thai and it's evident in how they treat their customers and the quality of their food and services.    I have and will continue to recommend this restaurant to anybody looking for the best Thai restaurant in the Valley and will definitely be back for more.

nyMDFmRDUmE3p2Chm_khFg.text: I read Michele Laudig's review of Takeda Thai on Phoenixnewtimes.com and I have to say I pretty much agree. Why is it so hard to find great places in this town? Thank God I found this one. PNT review: tinyurl.com/kkpmyu

STayxwmkaPRBUdimdrnuzg.text: Takeda Thai is the best Thai restaurant in Scottsdale.  The location is hidden but the food is remarkable.  Behind the fire torches, sits a positive energy,open, inviting Thai bistro.  The place is incredibly clean and the food is always fresh.  The portion size is slightly small, but the quality is top notch.  I highly recommend it.

uHWC3cOPZ1Wsu3rBowh4pg.text: Best service , personable  and the food is Devine . What else needs to be said ? Moulay's Thai food is a must try .

jOW-5lKIXi9l2EZaxnFjgw.text: Great Food, Great Service, Great Ambiance. Friendly Staff. Well worth a visit. Best Thai food in Arizona.

hQjqwXRI3x7WNRZNeVS0ow.text: Been there 2times. Over all 3star. Inside was too dark for me. Hard to see the menu. Food was ok not the great compared to price. They open dinner only.

EWfJSbJBfhmiYVOz5v16hA.text: Easily the most authentic Thai food in town, Moulay and his team produce the cleanest tasting Thai food I have had in Phoenix. The eggplant is to die for.

2zZDSKNvvjVAYKPGYrEehw.text: The dish was soo boring. I have eaten way better Thai food . Very disappointed for paying $17 for a noodle dish !

QJaK2m7JsCW6MWygU0-itQ.text: Hands down the best Pad Thai I have ever tried. I have lived in New York and Los Angeles and tried many Thai restaurants and this is hands down the best. The chef is a True artist at his craft. Delicious!!

_BSkkCKPY9ZnB-lHXHpC9Q.text: This is a sweet little gem and the food is delicious! I really liked their green curry, fried rice, and Thai tea!!  So glad to have found this place! Moulay, the owner, is such a smart chef and knows how to create incredible food from a scientific perspective...which is a major bonus!!

f30Zd4EcZqziUTcufd4Z-A.text: Clearly other guests don't know a good Thai .. it's a shame but haven't found anywhere in Scottsdale that is tasty, authentic, uses the correct ingredients and cooked well ... most of the places seem to have 4 stars which is misleading and I chose this place because of that reason.  Apologies to the restaurant as I'm sure the staff are great and I don't like giving negative reviews. If you have never been to Thailand then this will I'm sure be great for you.

ZHcLetLkwaM-vNT9eRZefA.text: Came here on a Friday night and only like 2 other people were dining. With such good food I'd expect it to busier! I love Thai food and always get especially excited when I find a place that serves pumpkin curry with tofu as an option. Plus they had a variety of other specialty curries as well that I found intriguing. My boyfriend wanted to get the cucumber with lime salad to start and we both loved it! It was fresh and crunchy, very refreshing. I hadn't had a salad like that before from a Thai place. The man who served it to us told us he was the one who made it too which was cool! For this meal he ordered red curry noodles with chicken. He enjoyed it! I got the pumpkin tofu red curry and it was amazing, creamy, and flavorful but I was sad about the portion size, like I left the restaurant still craving more curry. Not to mention it was quite pricey for portions that did not fill us up really. However our food tasted good and everything seemed fresh. I'd recommend for a splurge every once in a while! But maybe don't come if you're starving and wanting a lot of food like I did haha.

L_sWEucl3v5fYmGDjXgh7g.text: The food at Takeda is very good , but small portions and very pricey expect to pay at least 2 $$ signs per person. The establishment is located in a strip mall on shea parking is ample. Can be quite dark later in the evening, be warned if ordering form door dash it will take close to an hr to recieve food. The pros the forbidden rice is very tasty but it is 2 dollars for a small side, and the food is flavorable  Cons small portions, steep prices

2UvB14BVMopaBwWT9hw6YA.text: An unexpected gem in Scottsdale. Everything is fresh and delicious, we had Pad Thai and salad. We spent some time chatting with the owner/chef Mulay. He quit his high level engineering job to do what he loves, and it shows in the quality and attention he gives to the food. Next time in I'm Scottsdale I'll be back! Oh, and don't miss the handmade coconut ice cream, I have never tasted better.

Q4o7iy90gOX4zwfy3Q5hwQ.text: And this place is amazing... service was superb, and the atmosphere was very quaint and comfortable. Start with the charred edamame- just delicious. We had the yellow curry and the pad Thai and they were both perfect. I can't wait to go back to try more dishes.

_csaHAq3LhAv1CcXVNEC4A.text: I work the same complex and have been coming here for lunch for years. I have always been very pleased with the quality of food here. My favorite things to order are the thai basil chicken, Tom Kha Gai (coconut milk soup), and the pad ped. The Uncle Som's pad ped is seriously the best Thai dish I have ever had, and is now what I order every time. The flavor is bold and complex, extremely delicious! I also LOVE spicy food, and they can make it as spicy as you want. The veggies are always very fresh and flavor is always consistent. With his delicious and creative take on traditional dishes, Moulay is a True virtuoso of Thai cuisine.  Note: They are only open on Wednesdays now for lunch.

I should've turned around when another  customer was so mad about waiting longer than an hour for his take out..he stormed out! We were told 35min to pick up which we arrived 40min but the order wasn't ready...15more minutes I grew more impatient after they told me my order is still not ready ...so I walked out:( Crazy The restaurant was empty!  If they were honest on the phone  for not having the staff to do take out...I would have tried them another time!  They are very pricey for bad service!

iLr8mQ6MIQJjVFL_KJ0iLg.text: Takeda Thai, our 1st visit,   Crab puffs  Roti Kanal   Potstickers  Larb (lettuce wraps) The star entree was, hands down  Crispy Pla - Whole Tilapia Lightly breaded, w/ choice of garlic chili sauce or basil curry sauce and Sweet and Sour Beef We highly recommend Takeda Thai
