yEGVQWogOAjUT0lUjb7lGA.text: Consistently great food. Never been disappointed in the food or service over many years. Wonderful delicious place.

rRABE8WBGxpD5owmXGelOw.text: This is the best Thai food in the valley! Incredible! We ate there last week-end, and have already been back twice for take out. Moulay, is so welcoming, fun and awesome, and once you taste the food; you will be so very happy you did. I was walking out tonight, as another customer was walking in. We chatted for a minute about how awesome the food is. He said he has traveled the world, and that Moulay is a wizard at what he does. So delicious. We will be back soon!

u4gCyDclQ1x552b3XCYiFA.text: Amazing. Best Thai food I have ever eaten in Phoenix. The ambiance is great, and the service is even better. It's a family owned business, a husband and wife. The owners visited our table, brought out a dish to try on the house, and he told us about why they opened the restaurant. I kept it classic with chicken pad thai, but you should experiment because everything they make us delicious!

S30MPv-OPa67l2vWvUUx2g.text: Saturday night was a special event.   Had great jazz by Doc Jones and great food (as always) by Moulay.  Terrific combination!

eyz5Q6Y_v93uYu5ifEl5tg.text: It is the best!! The food was phenomenal and the homemade coconut ice cream was an excellent finisher. Thank you for an incredible experience.

mywDxBn3fKPZhXZqcOx9Uw.text: My friend and I visit this restaurant a couple weeks ago after reading about it on this site. This place met all our expectations. We fell in love this place and will defiantly be going back soon. The atmosphere was charming. The service was great and the food was amazing. We ordered the Wok Charred Edamame, Chicken Pad Thai, and Yellow Curry. I would order it all again. The owner/chef is great! Best thai i have had!

YslNEEznyQsO6j_tz-JKJw.text: Had to jump in for beauty supplies next door w me mum so the outside of this place really caught my eye! We decided to stop for a bite. It was a late lunch maybe 4 tables were occupied the place felt a tad small inside so we opted to have the patio all to ourselves. Waiter was nice and helpful. I ordered the Pad Thai w shrimp and my mom did the red curry. The shrimp were a nice plump size they were cooked perfectly, I wish there would have been more shrimp on the plate but ce est lavie. The veggies were nice and fresh I thought it was very flavorful compared to other places I've tried Thai food. Not too many places have even left an impression on me the food is usually pretty bland. I tried my moms red curry and it was delicous. The Thai Tea was awesome I wish I had one right now. It was good I will return!

5UmWi7CLApj-P1XZ81QgCA.text: I want to give this place 4 stars, but overall the food just wasn't 4 star caliber.  Started off with the crab fritter things and the tempura shrimp.  Neither were that good...the crab fritters were more or less just a really garlic-y creamy filled deep fried pocket and the the batter of the tempura shrimp was pretty oily and thick.  For the main courses I tried the pad thai, chicken panang, and the pepper garlic tofu.  The pad thai was typical but it was served with skinny noodles similar to spaghetti...personally I prefer the wider, almost a smaller fettuccine type noodle with pad thai.  The pepper garlic was pretty tasty and the veggies on that dish were the best part.  The most memorable part was the chicken panang.  Served with rice...it was rich and coconutty and really tasty.  Actually it could have been a little spicier, but it was definitely the best thing I had that night.  The service was great and the restaurant had a great atmosphere.  The more I think about it, the main courses were a little bit above average taste wise, but I think the problem for me was that it was the most expensive Thai place I have been to.  You weren't really getting that much more for the higher price point.  However, I most likely will be back.

QfqC2qt4gPbDi8_SspTCXQ.text: Best thai food in the state of Arizona next to Tasty Thai. Excellent service, high quality ingredients, nice atmosphere. Everything is excellent!

vZq4t1i5BeC_PKd6gU13Tw.text: I have been here a few times.  The pad thai is good here, and I would recommend the food.  The restaurant is decorated nicely and has good curb appeal.  The service has always been very slow.  The wait staff isn't quick to refill water or do anything really, and the food takes 30-45 minutes to come out (and it wasn't busy).  This isn't a good place to go if you have a limited amount of time.

3Edq0tQ4fbz6vrZD_bST8A.text: We've been here a few times and have never been disappointed by the food. I love the Eggplant and zucchini in black bean sauce with chicken. It is flat out delicious. The pad thai isn't my favorite though. Ordered with a "5" heat factor it was more sweet than hot but my companion didn't seem to mind (although he did agree that my dish was better).  We overheard another patron complain about her food being too hot. This prompted the owner to come around to each table and inquire if anyone else felt their fare was overly spiced. We happily disagreed and said if anything we thought it wasn't hot enough! I liked that the owner checked it out before going back to the complainer and letting her know (politely) that she was the only one in the place that was unhappy. THe only complaint I had was the wait. Someone must have called in sick because there was only one server for the whole place! The bartender was helping out but it all took way too long. I like the place, so I will be back and hope more staff is on when i go.

O4S68qJ9TCZ8gqQKbFwzcQ.text: Had lunch here today. The green chili curry was awesome

LvrjuLDAH7qOC5Px_QjWlA.text: Finally a great Thai place in Scottsdale.  Have tried most of the curries there but keep on coming back for Red Curry with soft tofu. It is top notch !!

98xUq-v5dxV4IELFhs7LwA.text: A co-worker and I were in from out of town and decided to try out this place based on some of the reviews we read on Yelp.  I'll have to say that I wasn't that impressed.  First off, let me say that the service was very good.  Our waiter always kept our drink glasses full and was very attentive. Now on to the food... We decided to start off with Lettuce Wraps.  They were very good...although a little spicier than I would have expected for a "2" out of "5" spice level. I ordered the grilled shrimp with the thai peanut sauce.  It took a while for the food to come out and when it did the food was lukewarm.  The shrimp tasted like it had been pre-cooked and then tossed on the grill to heat it up a bit.  It was very dry.  The veggies were steamed but cool and the Thai peanut sauce was also on the cool side.  The brown rice was pretty dry and a little tough to choke down.  Definitely not worth the $17.95 for the dish. My friend got the Thai Basil with chicken - I tried a couple of bites and wasn't that impressed.   I was very suprised at the small portion sizes - I would have exprected more for the price we paid. Unfortunately, I can't give this place another chance since I don't live in Scottsdale but even if I did live there I can't say that I would go back anytime soon.

BVxX2lta9Gb2eXxs8HmVdA.text: I'm officially addicted! My husband took me to TT for our anniversary. We love the outdoor seating and romantic ambiance. The short ribs are a must!

7M5YBGrlnrPJZc1k1rSugg.text: The inside looked much better than the outside.  It has a nice quaint setup, but they need some work on atmosphere.  AC was a bit cold and the lighting was very dim.  The food was fine, but the wait is very long.  They told us everything was made from scratch, but I think that is code for "expect a long wait."  Price is high and I left still hungry.  My vote, look elsewhere for Thai food.

1EeJwDKpkf7h8cRZEpKDnQ.text: Food was great! Panang curry, papaya salad and spicy noodles (pad kee mow) were all great! Entree prices (fish) were super high so we didn't order those, but would I imagine they would be good.  They didn't give us enough rice for the curry, but gave us extra rice at no extra cost when we asked.  Hope this good place is still here next time I am back in Scottsdale!

JfLs5uwxBmtlpZUljdsG5w.text: I'm visiting Scottsdale from Seattle and I'm very familiar with Asian cuisine.  The appetizers were stellar, the dinner was fantastic and the atmosphere and service was first class. If you desire great Thai food at a good price, you can't miss with Takeda.

qKfV2SaqGsRK1GBxWzF0sQ.text: Yay!! Great little neighborhood GEM! Mussel app was delicious lovely and complex flavors. The shrimp with eggplant and zucchini was fresh and the sauce, perfect. My boyfriend LOVED the red curry duck. The spice level was just right. Shhhhh.... Our "heat level" was only a zero! Maybe braver next time ;) We will absolutely be back. Oh BTW the coconut ice cream (clearly freshly prepared) should not be missed!

y15rm_M6gbFanp8HxaQgkQ.text: Don't be fooled by a pretty face. Every review I've read about Takeda Thai raves about the fancy facade and upscale interior of this small strip mall restaurant. I think belief is suspended at the door, as most reviewers go on to praise the food. Phoenix Magazine even rated it one of the 23 best new restaurants in its October issue. That actually is my reason for writing this entry - to give a dissenting view.  For lunch today, we ordered pad thai ($7.95 from the lunch menu, $13.95 at dinner), garlic mini pork ribs ($10.95) and angel wings ($11.95) from the appetizer section. Our very nice waitress brought us two bowls of soup instead of the one we were entitled to. It was a mild chicken soup with a few vegetables and some tofu floating in it. OK, certainly not notable. Then the rest of the dishes came out. I was truly shocked by the plate of riblets. There were 6 tiny riblets on a bed of wilted lettuce. Remember, these cost $10.95!!! They had been fried to death and had no garlic taste. I looked closely at the lettuce and noticed a few bits of overly browned garlic sprinkled on it. These clearly had never touched the ribs. This was downright insulting. The portion size of the angel wings was somewhat better. Angel wings are large chicken wings which have been boned and stuffed with vegetables, minced chicken and glass noodles, then fried and sliced. Like the riblets, these had been overcooked and were totally dried out. The insipid "sweet and sour chili dip" tasted only of sugar, and dunking the slices of wing in it did not revive them. Somehow the "chef" even managed to turn out dry pad thai with a horrible fishy back taste. When our waitress came over and asked which was our favorite thing, the only answer I could give was "the service". Our cost, even with a 10% discount coupon, came to $40.  I guess I could give the restaurant and its reviewers the benefit of the doubt and say that perhaps since it was lunch time a talented chef was not on duty. However, if that's the case, and no one better than the person who was in the kitchen could be found, then lunch should not be served  The only review I read that got it even partly right was from AZ Central. It said "the kitchen assumes you don't want to play with fire, so everything here is mild enough to feed a newborn."  I hope you won't think I'm a grouch, but I did want to warn you.

0ZpAJgJkxlGEocHnH5IvUQ.text: Excellent!  I really hope word of mouth gets around, because this is a very cute, good quality restaurant worthy of a long and prosperous existence.  The service was good, water was refilled promptly, and the owner was friendly.  The decor is elegant and more modern than most Thai restaurants I've visited.  The food is reasonably priced, with a good variety of vegetarian and meat dishes.  I went with the Spicy Noodles served medium.  They had just the right amount of heat.  The sticky rice with mangoes was light and flavorful.  I'm looking forward to stopping by for lunch sometime soon.

G5c9pnR2sxYjQ4w3GwXNJQ.text: Good location, great ambiance, very friendly staff, and delicious food!   What more do you want?

0-xJupqGU6FJ13_f2RnIGQ.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our evening at TAKEDA THAI. Both the service and food was outstanding and we are looking forward to a return visit.

_jCas6hzDq2X-QvbsDI6yA.text: Never walked out on a restaurant before. We waited 45 min and still no food. When they did bring something out, it was wrong. The food was over priced (by the look of the food on the other tables). Ended up going to Thai house around the corner and was super pleased.

vAsdy1f6HcmjOVNsdu8xWg.text: This is now our favorite Thai place in the valley, and even though we live on the other side of town, we have been there several times. The owners are very friendly and the atmosphere is elegant without being snobby. Tom Ka Gai soup is the best. I'm not a Thai food expert, but I'd say this place is one of the best you'll find. Highly recommended!

-FVZ4LIzFDwbrULnIuq1EQ.text: This has by far the best Thai food in Arizona. Maybe even beyond. Consistently fresh and delicious. Great service and welcoming atmosphere. We love it here and continue to come back. Always a great!   The owner always stops to say hello, or sends out a nice treat. We get the Pad See Ew, our favorite dish and their charred Edamame is so so good.   We have brought many friends in, And without fail, everyone has loved it.

LP5H2RZpokFS_KATvC29cA.text: I'm trying to figure out why the reviews are so good for this place. I came here with my coworkers for dinner on Saturday night and we ordered drinks, appetizers and entrees. I got a Thai ice tea and it was the worst one I've had and I've been to many places around the country. The crab Rangoon was burned, fried tofu was ok and the coconut shrimp didn't get finished. Service is very slow.   Don't recommend this place.

P5IupOleRY5cnjidcq1hig.text: True story:  I opened my dish at home (pad prikh king) and my sister asked me if I farted.....it was just the smell of the food. It smelled like farts.   My sister's dish, she ordered spice level 0 but it had chili flakes in it and tasted like fire.   0/0 would recommend.

zgefL2NY8c1pJbkOAA5uWA.text: Great place and great food. The only thing is sometimes a bit too much lemon grass in the curries. It is finely chopped but the toughness of it sometimes gets stuck in the throat and is a little overpowering. However I would recommend this place as best and most authentic Thai food in Scottsdale and service is second to none. Go get some great Thai food and try the green curry and the Penang curry they are great.  5 stars      for sure.

wXnsdrnsr08VqP1GWy-GrA.text: My favorite Tai food ever! Moulay the owner and chef continues to delight with his delicious choices.. Charred edamame to start! All of his curries are great, pick your own heat. Can't get enough of his soups and house  specialties always fresh and beautifully presented. Chicken with ginger... yes! And if you're not too full, nobody does coconut ice cream from scratch like Moulay! Casual atmosphere with soft lighting too. Highly recommend!

hvU0ROm5VdDWYR1i3Jjuww.text: Delicious green curry, pad see-ew! Food greasy, Chef Moulay provided great hospitality. Looking forward to trying more of the menu. We will be back!

fXv0OkwcAPT9J68r3T-qfQ.text: We went to this place last night for a birthday dinner for my friend. We waited 2 hours to get our meal. They said only one cook and the two people serving us were friends of the owner and helping out since there was no help staff. It was difficult to even get a drink. If the food is slow at least keep us from being thirsty. I kept thinking the wait surely will be worth it and the food was just average. It was the first time I really had to dig deep to give a tip. I didn't want to be rude but 2 hours? No concession and no apology? I will never go to this place again. If I could give it a 0 star I would.

UsdN6D01NQDT0EnfxZXUaQ.text: Very very good. Hidden in a shopping center that in itself is somewhat hidden. Food I'm told is made from scratch, and it tasted as such. So yummy. We had a plethora of appetizers and main dishes. Green curry, fried rice, and Tom Kha to name a few. Best Tom Kha I've ever had!! Ever.   The atmosphere was amazing as was the service. Try it, it's a must!!

mJqx0ELZ9oj9U7z_lp5h0w.text: My husband and I moved to Scottsdale and were bummed to be 30 minutes away from our favorite Thai restaurant downtown. We tried Takeda Thai tonight and were overjoyed to discover it is even better than our (former) favorite place. We ordered the mango curry and the Pad Thai. Both were delicious. The Chef even brought out an appetizer he made for us on the house (also delicious). This place is a gem!

3spqZO3tIcbAd-u5KWPinA.text: Had to try.  I own  Il Bosco Pizza which is next to Handlebar Js (across Scottsdale rd). Heard so Much about it.  Was amazing.  I have traveled the Asian world in my PRE restaurant ownerships days.  Truly authentic Thai food and with the individualistic  "soup nazi" owner (from the show Friends) personality, this place gives you everything you hoped for.  Great food, great ambience and a touch from the owner.  Gotta try it!!

V3faPFRrHhRBUXUeoL6r3A.text: Only issue ..  very hot and humid !!! Not sure if the air is broken or its always like this... very slow service . Ordered to go...  took over 30 min.  The soup was missing mushrooms... so it was broth and a little chicken.  Pretty disappointed...   Owner is giving me credit on the next order.  . Very pleasantand apologized.  Short handed it sounded like ... .will try again!

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Afj3nwHmLQGkUUlptbYbwQ.text: Outstanding. First time diner and I was very impressed. The grilled edamame was finger licking good. Best I have ever had. I had looked at the online menu before visiting and knew what I wanted. The owner/ chef/ waiter informed me that my desired meal had been removed from the menu but he would be happy to prepare it for me. I am so glad he did. Again, outstanding!! The noodles, shrimp and gravy were great. More upscale than other Thai restaurants I frequent. Very clean and "fresh" looking. I will definitely return to sample this chefs other creations.

BcRGcbvEaEtebq9QpaLfpQ.text: This restaurant was absolutely delicious. Every dish was served to us by the owner Mulay. He has extreme passion for his food and for the service that he provides to his customers. Everything was made fresh to serve. we look forward to going back to this restaurant the next time we are in town. The only complaint I have is that it was very warm inside and they did not put the air condition on.

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp pad thai
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken with flat noodles
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pad Thai

b-Tppidb-Yl7lPbZQpf3Dg.text: Great food, great service! I know a lot of people complain about their small servings, but I found it was just enough for a meal. No leftovers though. The place was nice and quiet, but the waiter was very kind, and the chef was personable. Delicious curry, and coconut soup! Fried tofu was good too. They have a ton of vegetarian options. Definitely coming again! :)

3pKGnoxG0g9T7HncImPnMw.text: When I walked in it was completely empty which scared me a bit. Gave it a shot anyways and was very satisfied. Had the salmon curry and chicken fried rice. Great choice. Curry was amazing. As I was eating it got busy so that was a good sign. Only thing I wasn't completely satisfied with was spicy level. I like very spicy so I asked for hottest which is "thai hot". Was decent but not what most "thai hot" places serve. But as I looked at the receipt I saw spicy level 3 and I could hear other people ordering and being offered up to spicy level 5 so maybe there was some confusion there. Either way very good meal. Will come back

NfaiWF3IMeth3ze-rE26Og.text: Best Thai food I've ever had! Service was good and the owner is amazing! A hidden gem!

e-TUre6OdqP4qer_nPf4BA.text: I will definitely be back! It's hard to find good Thai/Asian cuisine. Stopped in for soup and a snack when I didn't have much time. Service was perfect, food was TASTY! Best dumpling soup I ever had  the server treated everyone like family. Even walked around with someone's baby and was cool as a cucumber doing it! I can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes.

TjV1mofYnXKIb79ob8qa4Q.text: I am a loyal-regular customer...Moulay is my go-to Thai guy. Always satisfying and authentic...healthy, fresh ingredients made to order. Do yourself a favor and check out his deciduous flavors...MMmmmmm

JbF9s7JWc4bTlM-s7_b3NA.text: Decent thai food, not great.  The phad thai was very bland.  Red curry chicken was above average.

pd4GcuZUw0sWSMZj7H1iCQ.text: The absolute best Thai! And incredible service!!! If you go anywhere else you'll do yourself a disservice.  10 stars, 2 thumbs up!!! I could eat there every day!

oLDmcIIfoyZj9goViK6TZA.text: Came back for a second time and had the spring rolls, eggplant zucchini and panang (sp?) curry w/ brown rice. Definitely a 5-star experience!  Everything was delicious, service was fast and SO friendly. Lovin Takeda!

photos.caption: Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade coconut ice cream
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Panang Curry w/ tofu, green beans, and bell peppers. AWESOME!
Photo of Takeda Thai - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant and Zuccini w/ tofu (comes with any meat you want) - soooo good!!!

2PGWW8WXhZ8njHo-MBNpKw.text: I have been searching for a Thai restaurant that was authentic and fresh. This was the best I have ever had! The service was amazing and the food was very fresh, we saw the chef go to the garden and pick fresh basil for our dish! Trying to eat out and eat healthily is difficult these days not at Takeda's! Our server Sarah, one of the owners, knew how many calories were in our dishes, an unbelievable 400 for the best dish in town. We couldn't leave without a sample of the coconut ice cream a perfect end to an amazing meal! The coconut taste as though they had just picked it! We definitely will be going back and bringing friends!

6Qny9hE2Uqc2dzJDFYocGQ.text: My husband and I visited after reading the great reviews here.  Unfortunately, we were very disappointed.  The pot stickers were average, I ordered the seafood dish with mussels and shrimp and it had a horrible lake fish taste to it, I only had a couple bites.  My vodka drink was tasty, but overall the food was overpriced and I won't go back.  The owner was also our waiter and very nice, we just did not enjoy the food.

YTgXuD62cvKvGY-SoSvueA.text: So the first thing that strikes you when you walk in is that this is a beautiful restaurant. You can't help but be seduced.  We were greeted warmly at the door, seated immediately and given water and menus promptly. Each of the staff came through and introduced themselves, our server Rebecca tells us this is a family operation and apparently so because her mother and step-father (guessing here but probably got enough info to make this accurate) eventually come through, introduce themselves, offer to help with menu selections and we all feel welcome and well attended.  Food was very solid...rib appetizers, awesome. Green papaya salad was entirely tasty, but not spicy. Pad Thai and Thai Basil were not my choices but I certainly wasn't complaining either. Food was well prepared, pacing was perfect, rice was perfect.  If I had one complaint, it's simply the prices which just seem to be more than I would have to spend elsewhere in a good Thai restaurant (though I'm not going to name any names for comparison). Price setting is a marketing decision that they have made and perhaps given their location, decor, quality of food, many will think their pricing is reasonable but I don't.  Food, staff, experience all say 5 stars, pricing says no and that's my opinion.

JSOc0gZoGycnO4TkuKbb9g.text: Amazing food!! We go to Scottsdale for July 4th  every year and this is our "must visit restaurant" each time. Outstanding service, Nicholas could not be nicer and his recommendations are the best!! Love the salmon curry! Excellent bar as well. Moulay is the chef and owner and he makes a point to stop by each table to chat and check how you are enjoying everything. If you love great Thai food this is the place!

ww1O2BgH7zosphPl27jIVg.text: Place is fantastic. In town for work and have eaten here every night. That good. Owner is chef walks around and seems to really care about his incredible thai creations

LNBOH9N7n3EwqAuEy0ZmSg.text: We had the pleasure of having this delicious food delivered to our office. It was amazing. A mix of everything and it all rocked. The owner is hilarious and friendly. YUM!!!!!! Best Thai food. Best Service

5Q4kBLrZRUkpH0KD7_5sJw.text: Let me just add to the list of good reviews here...I've been to this place twice now and both times the experience has been great. The staff, 5 stars...ambiance gets 4.5 stars...and the food a solid 4.   The food is tasty and worth coming back for. I think the dinner menu is a tad bit high compared to what I'm used to paying back in San Diego for the same quality. While the price is higher than what I'm used to, I think they are spot on for the area, so keep that in mind when reading my criticism on the matter. The lunch menu has some great specials on it though, so I would highly suggest checking that out if on a budget.   Anyone on the search for a good Pad Thai should give this place a shot. I've tried several places since getting into Scottsdale and this is the best as of yet. I'll be making this place a regular destination.

73prkUXCF-IDAFkIKNk03w.text: New restaraunt in Scottsdale ... tucked back off Scottsdale Road just south of Shea on the East side fo the road.  A little hard to find ... WELL worth the effort.  Moulay and his wife have worked to change what was previously an old golf shop into a stylish, modern place.  Comfortable and easy to relax here.  The food was GREAT.  Very fresh, unique flavor combinations and all selections well done, nicely presented and right sized portions.  Anyone liking great Thai food will LOVE this place.  When I asked for 8 out of 10 heat, I got exactly what I expected.    Moulay was in the restaraunt along with his wife and they talked freely with me about their concept in opening the restaraunt and what came through loud and clear was their commitment to making dishes fresh when they are ordered.  The concept is executed wonederfully  I would highly recommend Takeda Thai ... great price, excellent value and a meal you will enjoy and return for often.

_tCdjmt7MQJJcf9A4UK33Q.text: The food is very good but the portions are small and they charge you for rice. Even the white rice which is a bit ridiculous. Prices are definitely on the high side and should include rice.

ekUQsfUHE0z_4YxRE6T5fA.text: A hidden jem!  Quiet, nice atmosphere with very attentive service.  Pad Thai was delicious and the thai basil with shrimp with fresh veggies and a flavorful broth that I wanted to drink!  We finished off the meal with coconut and chocolate chunck ice cream!   I will be back!

htkA24m8EYPPHFVTCcQEcg.text: Good addition to the restaurant scene in Scottsdale; however, this restaurant is somewhat hard to find since it is set back from Scottsdale Road.  The service was good, the atmosphere was nice and the food was quite tasty albeit quite spicy.  Our server warned us, but I wasn't prepared for how spicy it would really be - be warned!

Vc6YUAJFrZ4oP8nsWTGv-Q.text: I see why this restaurant is called the best Thai restaurant in Scottsdale.  Great food, good surroundings and friendly staff.  The green curry is delicious.  We can't wait to go back.  This restaurant is an undiscovered gem.

hOoyLj9WnQFRtFPOFbMlGA.text: I want to first say my girlfriend and I went to this restaurant because I know the owner Moulay. I also read the other Yelp comments beforehand so I was prepared.  We both loved it. Food was excellent (I had the pad Thai and it was probably the best pad Thai I've ever had), the surroundings were great and the staff was very attentive.  This would be a great place for a date.

7hjhc2LqGE_HYrUPSsI5xQ.text: Fabulous local experience. Elegant atmosphere, impeccable, owner delivered service. It was clear this is a place that thrives on regular local customers who return for the warmth and elegance of the owners. I am a Thai food foodie from the Bay area - everything was lovely. Couldn't have enjoyed my solo dining experience on a business trip weekend anymore. Highly recommend.

vGMs_BuE8U1hXIi9F3xAuA.text: Takeda Thai had amazing flavors! However, the service was not as great as it needed to be. We went with our kids and were waiting forever to get even plates, let alone the food. As for the food they were still good.Prices are reasonable but the restaurant is quite small and awkward. Also, the service was a bit awkward!

KtOfIJZDepNZvn4Y4GI0Xg.text: The food and the service was the absolute best. If you are looking for a nice place for an intimate dinner with friends or family this is the place to go. I was very impressed with the delicious quality of the food. Perfectly sized portions so you can still enjoy dessert. I had the fried bananas and Ice cream. This dessert has such an amazing flavor that absolutely nobody should miss out on. I had the lettuce wraps for an appetizer which was deliciously flavored and for the main course I had the Spicy Noodle dish with pork when I took the first bite all I could think was WOW! A good way to describe this restaurant in three words is love, care and quality. You are missing out if you don't give this place a whirl. You will not be disappointed.

dfmEBkLWqJSdTgE6LLSusA.text: I love when I am in Scottsdale on business so I can stop in the is place for lunch or early dinner! Ambiance is very nice and cozy. The food is made fresh and actually taste like it! Great place for a date too! I would only say that it can be a little expensive, but it is right in line with the cost of dinning in that area! Worth it for me!

y55jHWLI_YKJlIdgtB9xsA.text: Every visit---amazing.  I always look forward to my next visit.  Consistency is excellent and it's on my Top 5 list of restaurants I visit regularly now.   The Tom Kha Gai is still my absolute favorite, as is the Chicken Panang Curry.  Delicious---and the service is always tops!

yfkmOcGNhXeQ6w4Cgph4aQ.text: Where do I start? The good: friendly staff in a clean space. Ultimately however I go to restaurants to eat food. And when I go to a Thai restaurant I expected something with more than a passing resemblance to Thai food. I ordered "Thai hot" for my meal and what I got...let's just say I've had bowling alley nachos with more kick. Ordered steamed white rice..got some zero-gluten (read: non-sticky) brown rice. And they forgot to include my soup in my "to go" order. Finally, I ordered a Thai coffee and got what can only be described as plain black coffee with lots of heavy cream. A disaster. This all would have been made okay if what I *DID* get was actually tasty or well prepared. It wasn't. Undercooked beans, overcooked tough beef, a broth that seemed to be made from black pepper and water.   I honestly cannot think of a worse Thai restaurant.

7s-7FIpzOEhTCsiI9S-WyQ.text: Five Star service !!!!  .... and only Four stars on food because I ordered plain old red curry which was very good but I've yet to find a red curry that stands out from the rest of the pack... nor would I necessarily want one to.  Moulay is a very gracious Executive Chef, Proprietor and I was blown away by his down to earth interaction and great warmth.  A Moroccan who does Thai like a Thai native makes me happy.  Great mid day meal and I'll be back ... I am pretty sure my dinner picks will move me up to five stars.  Oh... and for rice... go ahead with forbidden rice... nice nutty flavor and a great complement ... Ok ... never mind .... FIVE STARS it is now that I thought a little more on it...   Highly recommended though I can't tell if Moulay hypnotized me or not :-)

y6jtEBafGgyM9dPxzoyG1g.text: The food was AMAZING!!!!! They have such a beautiful ambiance and an environment thats unbeatable. A truly beautiful place with authentic Thai food. Sarah(owner) and her husband(Moulay) the chef are amazing people with the most enthusiastic personalities ever! They truly know the definition of outstanding customer service. Im so coming back here time and time again!!!

Paow1yb69ekqBzHXj7OA_A.text: This place was amazing! I never knew it existed and it's right down the street, but it will be our new Thai place. The food was delicious, and the wait staff was super friendly. They checked on us just enough to make sure we were happy the entire time. I had the yellow curry, which was so good! Next time I might branch out and try the mango curry. We even tried the dessert which was coconut ice cream (tasted homemade) and coconut rice. Unique and delicious. We will absolutely be back!

EWkRSjuHLC8a8YzBkuRutQ.text: Avoid Takeda Thai by Moulay at all costs! My boyfriend and I came here last night and had a terrible experience. I rarely complain about food or service but tonight there was chicken bone in our lettuce wraps and I bit on a piece and it hurt my tooth really badly. THEN when I got my Mango Curry, the chicken was still raw on the inside! Completely unacceptable. Besides the food, the service was terrible, we waited over half an hour just for one appetizer, and another 20 minutes for the second one. Our curries took over an hour to get to us. Not to mention the manager was completely rude. At one point she reached over for my fork and took it off the plate that I was still using and placed it on the table, but didn't pick up the plate. It's like, why did you just touch my fork in the first place?! For the prices you pay, the food is subpar and portions are extremely small. $10.95 for five crab rangoons that are extremely small? Not to mention a $15.95 curry that comes in a small bowl with an even smaller bowl of rice? I can justify paying those prices for portions that keep up with cost. Come on. The manager didn't even want to apologize for the service we received and for the bone in the lettuce wrap or for the raw chicken in my curry. We offered to pay for what we did drink and eat but she said we didn't have to pay. Instead of apologizing, all she did was ask if we had been there before and after I said no, she looked at me and said "No, I'm pretty sure I've seen you before." I kept telling her no, that I haven't been here. They treat new customers like trash and praise returning customers from what it seems like. Avoid this place like the plague. There are much better Thai places out there.

iGnk_rCwM7IO-85bMk6xGg.text: I tried this place last night for the first time and I was very disappointed. I had the fried rice and it wasn't very flavorful and the scallions were very burnt and hard. The staff was very friendly but the food was a let down.

P0xizLBDzLrmFzs-DcWwMQ.text: For Moulay and Sarah especially:  Takeda Thai is a charming Thai cuisine restaurant, tucked away from the main road in Scottsdale. The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting, although, it is a smaller space the intimate setting is quite enjoyable.  The food was delicious, it was flavorful and full of bold spices!  The best part of our experience at Takeda Thai was our interactions with Moulay and Sarah. They were both very charming, sweet and genuinely interested in getting to know their customers and making them feel very welcomed. I would suggest Takeda to anyone looking for a low-key dining spot with great food and terrific service!

uSXIjObeizOM3_u_8PsffQ.text: I have been to Thai restaurants all over town and just got back from Thailand. This food is fragrant, fresh, crispy and tantalizing to the the senses. We actually missed this food when we were in Thailand.  The owner and chef is very personable and creates a mystical atmosphere of ambiance.  You can tell that the chef takes his time cooking his meals to perfection because  great food is meant to be sipped and not gulped.  I suggest Moulay's fried rice and Thai beef salad!  Delicious!!

jGnPRe80qmm9XLsnLRbywg.text: I've been here several times, and have yet to have an experience that I would classify as unpleasant.  First, I would have to say that all the comments about the service being slow are 100% accurate. I don't know what it is about the atmosphere here, but everything just goes really slowly. My water glass has never been left empty, but there have been several moments where I wondered where our server was.  I've never noticed the longer food prep times that others have mentioned, but I usually expect a slightly longer wait for Thai food in general.  The staff is always friendly and sociable.  Pricing is definitely an issue here, but its due to the small portions. I've actually not gone here on more than one occasion due to the price point/lack of value on your dollar spent.  Menu items I've tried:  Beef Salad (excellent, my favorite dish here) Edamame (get their special version, not the plain version) Beef Jerky (a little salty for my taste, more of a seared beef than jerky) Red Curry (just what you would expect, nothing great but not bad) Green Curry (just what you would expect, nothing great but not bad) Panang Curry (just what you would expect, nothing great but not bad) Tom Yum Soup (very good, get it with shrimp) Tom Kha Gai Soup (their best soup, very good with chicken or tofu) Drunken Noodles (excellent, good texture, good spice, great flavor) Pad Thai (love their version, not too sweet, good choice of noodles) Papaya Salad (not very good, I"m more inclined to the Isaan version that's spicier, this version is too sweet for me) Mahi Mahi with Black Mussels (very good, I was pleasantly surprised by this dish, it was an excellent recommendation by the server)  I would go back more often, but the portion sizes are small and the location is far away from me.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants good Thai food with a great intimate atmosphere. Bring a little patience with you and you'll be in for an excellent evening.

tYIo7R7ZNw0yJoc9JYt26Q.text: First I will say, this is a nice atmosphere and the food was fine. But for the price, the portion size, the $2 upcharge for brown rice (on top of the price for the lunch) and the very slow service at lunch, this is what brings me to the lower rating.   I've been to other Thai places here in the Valley, that the food has a little more flavor, the portions are better, the service faster, and no additional charges for a different kind of rice.  Give it a try, but don't expect a lot.

BhJpGw1JgSRoZ4ZZEuM8Jw.text: I absolutely adore Thai, and not only does this gem have truly SPECTACULAR food, the family that own Takeda go so far above and beyond in the care they show for their customers that they make it the kind of dining experience you will never forget. You would be doing yourself a great disservice to not try Takeda Thai, because this is one restaurant absolutely not to be missed!

0hMcj_3byY4K2jyYbFnUdQ.text: I'm a Thai food enthusiast. For years, my favorite Thai Place was in Florida, but now it's right near my son's place in Scottsdale. Takeda Thai is awesome. The food is absolutely delicious and the service is impeccable. Everything is fresh and most of the basil spice is picked from the garden which rings the entrance.  It's pricey, but you get what you pay for.

qWea16ki5pB2dFGSzhlChg.text: Takeda Thai has some amazing flavors! However, the atmosphere and service was not as great as it needed to be. I recommend the Phat Thai, it is truly an amazing dish that deserves to be on a cover of a magazine, it was delicious and you can choose your spice level. As for the curry dishes they were a bit salty but still good.  Prices are reasonable but the restaurant is quite small and awkward. Also, the service was a bit awkward! Other than that it is worth a try!

UfAHrf4Tm7ii2dycDUG7sQ.text: If  perchance you're one of the many Scottsdale residents who believe Malee's is the only place for good Thai, think again. You have another choice, it's Takeda.  Takeda's dishes, the result of generational family recipes prepared by the owner rival anything on Malee's menu and, I don't have to drive half a city away for it.  Last night I tried Uncle Som's something or other. It was splendid. I went with two and a half on the heat scale. I don't recommend this level of spice unless you're a seasoned pepper aficionado, one who routinely eats raw habaneros. My wife typically orders the same dish each visit, the green curry. Spicy and wonderfully delightful. But the coup de gras is their 'forbidden' rice.  We were informed how this rice got it's name from the King of Thailand who apparently forbade anyone to eat it except for him.  What an asshole, right?  Well it's a damned good thing someone smuggled the shit out of Thailand and got it into Scottsdale, where now, I can eat it at will.   Purple in color, short in grain, and when cooked to al-dente perfection, has a unique flavor all unto itself, never having tasted anything like it before.  The best way to describe it is this:  If I was King (Scottsdale), I'd command Ken Singh of Singh Farms to grow this stuff for me, and only me. Nobody would ever get to try it.  Well, maybe my wife if she was nice to me for a change and not alla-time smarting-off.  I'd let Ken Singh keep some for his trouble, but not very much.  And that's it... no-one else. Well, maybe Takeda.  Yeah, probably Takeda, since they already know how to cook it and all.  But that's it. No-one else. The rest of you would be shit out of luck.   Why I'd even post up security guards to make sure the kitchen help doesn't try weaseling off with their pockets loaded.  And all of you?  Forget it. Nobody gets to try my forbidden rice. Nobody. Why, I wouldn't even let you SEE it.  Not without paying a cover charge or something.   But sadly, I'm not the King of Scottsdale.  Shit.  Go to Takeda. Eat the forbidden rice and know, you're eating something that only a few hundred years ago in Thailand would have probably gotten your head chopped-off or something.

_LEXyjCYx09YqeAofqx_VA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the Valley. The food is fresh. It is a small business locally run by the nicest owners, Moulay and Sarah. They make you feel very welcome. It has a romantic ambiance with dark lighting and slow music. The first time we went in, Sarah sat down with us to explain the various dishes and her family history ties behind their quaint restaurant. You definitely get a dining experience here that you can not get at a chain restaurant. We always order the Tom Kha soup (it is my favorite dish there), the pumpkin curry (my second favorite), and the pad Thai. We always get the coconut ice cream, which Moulay churns and is super fresh every time.  Moulay is a truly artistic chef and has created a wonderful environment to enjoy a fresh, healthy, excellent meal.

Fy30xOnAHh3CXuVpuzLh3Q.text: After searching and searching for a good Thai restaurant, I have finally found one. Takeda Thai is incredible. Starting with the grilled edamame, followed by the Tom Kha Gai (absolutely delicious, could not stop filling my bowl), the green papaya salad, yellow curry with chicken, pad thai that was incredible.....and that decadent scoop of homemade coconut ice cream. It was Heaven..and Moulay and Sarah are beyond charming and attentive. Can't wait to go back again, and again, and again.

7vhH5YSQNEw8enZobEySbQ.text: My sister and I came here and LOVED IT. The owner came to our table and talked to us about his restaurant and you could see the passion he had for the food and the restaurant. The food was delicious, we got the spicy noodles and lettuce wraps, I got a level 3 spicy which was probably a little too much for me, a 2 would have been perfect. The Decor was very authentic and classy, I will definitely eat here next time I'm in Scottsdale!

tU1qTIwaRJx6FVLIOn1g8A.text: It took a little while to get our order taken. For some reason they brought my husbands meal out first then he had to sit there letting it get cold while waiting until mine showed up. Very strange to bring out the two plates at different times, at least five or more minutes apart. Food was good and the spice level was very good. They brought more water without us asking. Nice variety on the menu. The only negative I would say is that the portions here are smaller than other Thai restaurants. I usually have leftovers for lunch, but here we were both able to finish the portion. Also, the price is higher than others we have been to. It was nice inside with pretty wood carvings on the wall.

VE33gfvfL7MxmtE5Y0B0HQ.text: My friend and I decided to try Takeda Thai  after her reading glowing reviews of this ethnic establishment.  So on a weekday lunch we decided to give it a try.  At around noon only one other table was occupied.  We both decided to order the green curry with chicken as that's one of our favorite Thai dishes.  When the dishes were brought out, we were dumbfounded at the small proportions on the plate/bowl..(see accompanying picture- using a spoon for sauce depth reference. The vegetables in the picture look sufficient enough, but that's because I spread the mound of them out in the bowl.)  We decided not to bring this issue up but when the check arrived my friend mentioned to the waiter how SMALL the portion was for the price - $7.99 and explained that at Thai House - located very near to this establishment - portions were much more generous - take-out being in a quart container for $9.99.  The waiter (who was actually the owner, as he told us) said:  "It's a lunch" -although that was not denoted on the menu - which was kind of confusing in itself.  Then he said:  "You want MORE???   I'm the owner, I can give you all you want."  We agreed to that.  When the entree came out, there was only one entree instead of the expected two - and two plates were put down  - his expectation that we would SHARE the one entree!!  The portion was just as small.  When my friend examined the check, he CHARGED for the additional serving!   In addition, we both had Thai tea that ratcheted up  the bill another $8.  I've usually paid around $2.50 at other Thai restaurants for Thai tea.  Needless to say, we won't be going back there - ever!  $42. (including tip - don't ask me WHY she left a tip) was way too pricey for an afternoon lunch.  I might add that 3 small bowls of soup were ordered for a child that was with us - those at only  65 cents each.  One dessert touted as "homemade" - coconut ice cream was $5.95.  You can see a picture of that if you type Takeda Thai into Yelp's search bar.  Looks like the serving is one scoop :(    Post Script....I thought I could add a pic to this review but turns out I can't

9t68YlVMlHXk0Rr8rrAs8w.text: favorite Thai place in Arizona! Moulay adds his personal flair and chef expertise to everything he prepares, every dish on the menu is delicious and is always just a bit different from the other Thai places around.  Our family has been going for years now and this place has never disappointed. truly a little hidden gem of authentic amazing Thai cuisine.

kY6WQDAzlrN5GA336iW6nQ.text: Typically, a Thai restaurant is in a run-down center between the karate studio & the tattoo parlor. Not the case here! The place is elegant - from the front entrance to the beautiful restrooms.  And the food is terrific! Moulay is there to guide you and he is absolutely charming. And the menu is completely different from other Thai places. The items on the menu come from Moulay's wife's family and are both interesting and delicious.

GyUZ5UeRcPvb50oPHW2BPA.text: The smell of wonderful Thai food greeted us as we entered.  We were greeted by a friendly gentleman who showed us to our seat promptly.  The calamari dish was very tasty, although the fish was somewhat chewy.  The Thai basil and pad Thai both prepared with chicken met our expectations.  Felt a bit rushed, even though the restaurant was nearly empty.  Found the female server to be very unfriendly. Four stars may be slightly generous. Will continue to search for my go to Thai restaurant.

dYyLckaZmHX0lBCSI0hOCw.text: We decided to try out a new place tonight and we are very happy we did. Staff was very friendly and gave great recommendations. Charred Edamame, Mango Curry and an assortment of desserts. Chef even made us his own summer cocktail. We will be back!

Xh0Fp593HSFgiqcLDxEZgw.text: Service is terrable. We went on a Friday night, there was 1 server, 1 bartender, 1 busboy for the whole restaurant.... But, at the end we realized our server was actually the head chef and the owner! Totally changed our view.  Do not order a mojito, it's not impressive, I sent mine back. The table next to me was not impressed either.   Food on the other hand is delishious. We dinned on the following: Fire roasted Edamame Chicken Satay Yellow chicken curry Pumpkin chicken curry  Coconut ice cream   Everything was amazing, truly impressive. I highly recommend a visit to this little gem of a place. I would give it 4 Sayra based on the service but, knowing how hard everyone was working I felt bad and have to give them a 5.

y9JUgz0zd1F34MBCjuaRLA.text: Real authentic taste of Thai foods! Very friendly owner, we can eat at Takeda Thai food everyday. My kids love their green curry chicken, my hubby found the love of his life Phad-see-eew, the Best we have taste it around the world! We love Takeda Thai foods!!!!

R9S6ZHgGH8GZLB8dq0mcvw.text: I wouldn't come back ever bcuz of their poor service. We went on valentine's day with my 4 months old baby. there weren't many people. no one was at reception ,waited there for 5-7 minutes, two servers were taking orders even after finishing their jobs , they looked at us, did not say anything and seemed they ignored us. We did not wait for long and left immediately .

lRb2XyHQg8lts8IE5Ce7Cw.text: Best Thai food I ever taste! My favor is Pad See-ew chicken or pork. It's delicious! All their dishes are very good and flavorful. The owner is very nice and friendly. Try it! You won't regret it! Grate deal for lunch special!

doBnnLpoZMDRwRDfOFQpCQ.text: Best Pad Thai and Chicken Noodle Soup!!

frtFb55Xe7PisHdMl-FiYA.text: I totaly agree with some of the comments on here, the food was good, but not specatacular. The expereince was grade "f" Very disapointing.  The menu was limited because , the witer said"there would be 100's of people lined out the door in a few minutes, " it was 7:30 pm then.  He acted unexperienced and kept touching us as though he were a relative.  When asked to explain the dishes all he could ay as that it would be lovely.  They nevver did get busy and we were only given a fork no other cutlery.  After the food was finished we ordered the famous cocunut ice cream which is all they ofered, sat there and waited, then our waiter came and asked how we enjoyed it, we told him we never got it, and at that point just wanted to leave. He was seen as others offered on here, visiting with the staff and regulars there. There was a wait girl who had on jeans and sports shoes under a chef coat, very down beat addition the expereince that they so badly try to give.  it wass so dark with no candles, very hard to read the menu. The owner wh we spoe to and offereed our feelings about the eperience said he is very wealthy and this is his hobby, he offered a refund and we refused, so he gave us the ice cream to go.   Let me jsut say it was not the money, but for the prices the service and the ambiance should have been top notch.  I feel the proces do not match the atmophere or the service, and i might add the owner wanted to do nothing but argue about that as well.

sTZjPh7rB3THF5iyHyWahQ.text: Service is always excellent . I have been here many times and the food is terrific , from the salads to the curries to the soups...Always spiced to your order it is a nice quiet place to enjoy dinner

nb8aDmRzKKBbzqIDibYnNA.text: One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. We came here with a large group and they took such good care of us. The red curry is out of this world!! Do yourself a favor and go! Moulay (the owner) will greet you and provide you with the best experience. Last night was our first time here. We WILL be back!

FmrsDenrDU36goZSzfIcSA.text: We came to Takeda because of the reviews on Yelp and it was awesome!  I had a group of 10 come in and I called Takeda to see if they could accommodate us and Mulay (who I found out later was the owner) was so great and said in a funny way "you bring the people I'll get you the table"!  All of my friends loved the food.  We had spicey edamame and some people had the red curry.  I had the Spicey Noodles at a 2.5 level which was the perfect hotness.  The owner was so kind and generous and I could tell he was a really good guy.  The food was amazing and we will all be back! Go check it out!

TRMZrcQOSOkYau9INpXObg.text: So, so, SO good!  And the owner is amazing - so warm, friendly, AND the head chef.  I had a great mojito and chicken/veggie spring rolls appetizer.   It is kind of hidden in the middle/towards the back of a strip mall area at Scottsdale and Shea -- find it; IT IS WORTH IT.  The restaurant is small, intimate, dark, and would be a great date spot (however, I was allllll byyy myyyseeeeeellllff).  It is a super cute place that I am planning on returning to with my mom in the next week or two.  The prices are comparable for North Scottsdale.

z-f_qcmfw1u6D1PVrtKD_A.text: I went with my date. The waiter was very nice and friendly and was very accommodating when my date asked about the drink menu. I ordered the Pad Thai and I will only comment on my food. As stated, I ordered the Pad Thai with a spice level of 4 (their highest on the menu).   My food arrived and the presentation was average, but I'm here for food. I take a bite and I am immediately disappointed. The Pad Thai was sickening sweet! and the "4" spice level I asked for was non-existent. I am not the type to waste food but I left about 80% of my food on my plate and had no desire to take the leftovers home. How bad was my food, well, let's just say I left the restaurant hungry and ate as soon as I returned home.  I would not go there again for their overpriced sweet meal. This would be a 1 star if not for the good wait service.

rDh0QE3MPZhar-QsLYj7kg.text: Very romantic, cozy atmosphere. I had the red curry with chicken and there was plenty of chicken and the curry was phenomenal. My boyfriend ordered the whole tilapia and he had fun tearing through the perfectly cooked beast of a fish. The homemade coconut ice cream was a perfect finish. Nice quiet place to hide out and have some great food.

x4bLeRmSr5Lm897LCuJVbA.text: Great food And great service...  The owner is also always there and passionate about his restaurant. I am extremely satisfied to have found a Thai restaurant consistency and great price range, thanks Moulay!

4RpJoQQLeSB1pNXumR4Hbw.text: I attended this establishment with my friends around dinner time for take out. We walked into the place and were greeted by a skittish waiter who spoke very little english. The waiter escorted to the bar in the back were we confronted by an ambiance that was more middle eastern then Thai. Due to the waiters poor English, we recieved our check from  the chef in the back. The pad Thai we recieved was in incredibly small portions and not even made with pad Thai noodles.  I will not be attending this restaurant ever again.

pxLNexDacaLW_-utFx2JEw.text: We visited the restaurant during the week between Christmas and New Year's. We arrived at 6:15pm and there were about three tables occupied. It took over an hour to get our food. A nearby table of what appeared to be regulars were served within 10-15 minutes (before us) even though they arrived after us. Food was fine but we won't return due to the poor service.

MqnOw3Ri7Va3ojKBjjbINA.text: We love Thai food.  We ate here in early April the meal was very good.  We came back the next night and the restaurant was closed for family emergency.  We went back a third time in late April and had papaya salad and egg rolls, both of which were good.  We then ordered one of their specialties: roast duck.   When it arrived, we noted that it was a small duck cut into quarters, as opposed to slices of duck that you normally find. We each took one bite and immediately spit it out.  The duck was very old and spoiled.  (It seemed older than me and I am on Social Security.)  We asked for the bill and wanted to leave.  The owner/chef came out and asked us what was wrong.  We told him.  He offered to cook another, as it our duck had a younger relative in the fridge.  The owner reminded us that he has studied to be a chef in his home country of Morocco, not Thailand.  We asked for the bill and wanted to leave.  He brought the bill without charging us for the duck, but asked us not to write up a description of this restaurant.  We did not agree.  It might be that they do not serve duck often and it was just very old and badly prepared.  In any event, it should never have been served.  We will never go back.

tl3HmS9-SErkaeRRbMyPWA.text: Excellent Thai food and great service. I had the Pad Thai. I had it 4 star out of 5 spicy. While the flavor was good, I was expecting spicier. I'll will go again and try it 5 star.

cJGERmxB9JgkCygFQwfcXg.text: Normally, if we walk out of a restaurant feeling hungry ,still, I would give it one star. But the food here is good, actually, a lot better than the other ones I have been to in PHX area.  We don't expect to take leftovers home, but need to be able to wait 4-5 hours before we need to look for food again. When we walked out Takeda that day, my husband said, "we got to find something else." I had two restaurants myself in the past. One thing I learned is; if you want your customers to return, you have to at least make sure they are not leaving your restaurant hungry!
